signs.name: Accompanied Horses
signs.description: Horses (ridden or led) may be on or crossing the road; they can react unpredictably to noise or sudden movement.
signs.meaning:
🐢 Reduce your speed.
🤫 Avoid sudden movements or loud noises.
🐎 Give priority and plenty of space to horses and handlers.

signs.name: Barrier Board - 3 Bars
signs.description: Start of a taper—lane/shoulder begins narrowing ahead.
signs.meaning:
🔻 Indicates the lane will begin to narrow ahead.
🐢 Slow down and merge safely.
👀 Watch out for merging traffic.

signs.name: Barrier Board - 4 Bars
signs.description: Mid‑taper—remaining merging distance is reduced.
signs.meaning:
⚠️ Shows the remaining distance for merging is reduced.
↔️ The lane merge is in progress.
🚗 Proceed with caution, minding the traffic flow.

signs.name: Barrier Board - 5 Bars
signs.description: Taper end—closure point is imminent or lane fully ending.
signs.meaning:
🔚 Informs that the lane is about to end.
❌ The lane closure point is approaching.
➡️ Complete the lane merge safely.

signs.name: Cattle or Farm Animals
signs.description: Farm animals may be walking, crossing, or standing on the carriageway.
signs.meaning:
🐄 Warns that there may be farm animals on the road.
🐢 Reduce your speed and be cautious.
🛑 Be prepared to stop to give way to animals.

signs.name: Children Crossing
signs.description: High likelihood of children crossing (school/play area proximity).
signs.meaning:
🚸 Indicates you are approaching an area with a high likelihood of children crossing.
🏫 Be especially careful near schools and playgrounds.
🐢 Significantly reduce your speed.

signs.name: Compact Junction
signs.description: Tight/space‑restricted junction ahead; turning paths short.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Informs of a tight and restricted junction ahead.
🔄 Be prepared for sharp turns.
🐢 Reduce your speed to maneuver.

signs.name: Crossroads (Major Road) Ahead
signs.description: Crossroads with a major road—higher traffic priority crossing.
signs.meaning:
➕ Indicates an upcoming intersection with a major road.
🚗 Traffic on the intersecting road may have priority.
🛑 Be prepared to stop or yield.

signs.name: Crossroads Ahead at Dual C'way
signs.description: Crossroads intersects a dual carriageway—fast cross traffic possible.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ Informs of an intersection with a dual carriageway ahead.
💨 Traffic on the intersecting road may be fast.
👀 Carefully check for traffic from both directions.

signs.name: Crossroads at Sharp Corner - Left
signs.description: Crossroads hidden within/after a sharp left corner limiting sight.
signs.meaning:
↩️ Indicates a crossroads within or immediately after a sharp left corner.
🙈 Visibility is limited.
🐢 Significantly reduce your speed before entering the corner.

signs.name: Crossroads at Sharp Corner - Right
signs.description: Crossroads appears during/after a sharp right bend—limited view.
signs.meaning:
↪️ Informs of a crossroads within or immediately after a sharp right corner.
🙈 Your line of sight may be limited.
🐢 Be especially cautious and slow down when approaching the junction.

signs.name: Crossroads on Bend - Left
signs.description: Crossroads located along a left bend—restricted approach visibility.
signs.meaning:
⤴️ Indicates a crossroads located on a left bend ahead.
👀 Your visibility may be restricted when approaching the junction.
⚠️ Slow down and be prepared for unexpected vehicles.

signs.name: Crossroads on Bend - Right
signs.description: Crossroads located along a right bend—sightlines compressed.
signs.meaning:
⤵️ Informs of a crossroads on a right bend.
👀 You may have difficulty seeing the junction and other vehicles due to the bend.
🐢 Reduce your speed for a safe passage.

signs.name: Crossroads on Dual C'way
signs.description: Crossroads positioned on a dual carriageway—higher closing speeds.
signs.meaning:
➕ Indicates a crossroads on a dual carriageway.
🚀 The speed of approaching vehicles may be high.
🛑 Be very careful before entering the junction.

signs.name: Crossroads
signs.description: Standard crossroads ahead with potential multi‑direction conflict.
signs.meaning:
➕ Informs of a four-way intersection ahead.
↔️ There may be vehicles coming from different directions.
👀 Check the road carefully before proceeding.

signs.name: Crosswind
signs.description: Area subject to strong lateral wind gusts affecting stability.
signs.meaning:
🌬️ Warns of possible strong crosswinds.
🚗 The wind can affect your vehicle's stability.
🚚 High-sided vehicles should be particularly cautious.

signs.name: Cyclists Dismount
signs.description: Cyclists must dismount and proceed on foot beyond this point.
signs.meaning:
🚲 Indicates that cyclists must get off their bikes beyond this point.
🚶 You must proceed on foot.
🛑 Cycling is prohibited.

signs.name: Cyclists
signs.description: Likelihood of cyclists sharing or entering the carriageway.
signs.meaning:
🚴 Warns that cyclists may be on the road or joining it.
↔️ Give them plenty of space when passing.
👀 Be aware of their sudden movements.

signs.name: Deer or Wild Animals
signs.description: Wild animals may cross unpredictably, especially at dawn or dusk.
signs.meaning:
🦌 Indicates that deer or other wild animals may suddenly appear on the road.
🌅 Be especially cautious at dawn and dusk.
🐢 Reduce your speed and keep your eyes on the road.

signs.name: Drive on Left (Entry Point)
signs.description: Reminder to keep left (often at borders or car parks).
signs.meaning:
⬅️ Reminds you to drive on the left.
🚗 Often found at entry points like ports or airports.
🌍 Foreign drivers need to be cautious.

signs.name: Drive on Left (Repeater)
signs.description: Reiterates left-side driving in areas with visiting drivers.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ Reiterates that you must continue to drive on the left.
🔁 Emphasizes you are in an area where this rule applies.
👀 Often found in areas with a high number of tourists.

signs.name: Dual Carriageway Ends
signs.description: Separation ends and two-way opposing traffic resumes.
signs.meaning:
↕️ The divided highway is ending ahead.
🚗 Prepare for two-way traffic with oncoming vehicles.
⚠️ Stay in your lane and be aware of opposing cars.

signs.name: Falling Rocks
signs.description: Risk of rockfall or debris on the carriageway.
signs.meaning:
⛰️ Warns of the potential for rocks falling onto the road.
🪨 Be alert for debris on the carriageway.
🚗 Proceed with caution and avoid stopping in this area.

signs.name: Ford
signs.description: Shallow water crossing of variable depth.
signs.meaning:
🌊 Indicates a shallow water crossing ahead.
🚗 Proceed with caution as water depth may vary.
🐢 Drive slowly to avoid stalling or losing control.

signs.name: Humpback Bridge
signs.description: Steep profile bridge with restricted crest visibility.
signs.meaning:
🌉 Warns of a steep bridge ahead which limits visibility.
🐢 Reduce your speed as you cannot see oncoming traffic.
👀 Be cautious of vehicles from the other side.

signs.name: Jaunting Cars
signs.description: Horse-drawn tourist vehicles may travel slowly.
signs.meaning:
🐴 Be aware of slow-moving, horse-drawn tourist carriages.
⏳ Be patient and prepare to slow down.
↔️ Overtake only when it is safe, giving plenty of space.

signs.name: Junction With Major Road at Sharp Corner - Left
signs.description: Major road junction emerges at or after a sharp left bend.
signs.meaning:
↩️ A major road junction is located at or after a sharp left bend.
🙈 Visibility of the junction is severely limited.
🐢 Slow down significantly before the bend.

signs.name: Junction With Major Road at Sharp Corner - Right
signs.description: Major road junction appears inside or after a sharp right corner.
signs.meaning:
↪️ A junction with a major road appears within or after a sharp right corner.
🙈 Your view of traffic on the major road is restricted.
🐢 Approach with extreme caution and be prepared to stop.

signs.name: Lane Loss (Four to Three Lanes) - Left (with 400m panel)
signs.description: Left lane ends in 400 m—four lanes reducing to three.
signs.meaning:
🔢 The number of lanes is reducing from four to three.
⬅️ The left-most lane will end in 400 metres.
🚗 Prepare to merge into the adjacent lane safely.

signs.name: Lane Loss (Four to Three Lanes) - Right
signs.description: Right lane terminating and capacity reducing.
signs.meaning:
🔢 The road ahead narrows from four to three lanes.
➡️ The right-most lane is ending.
🚗 Move into a continuing lane in good time.

signs.name: Lane Loss (Three to Two Lanes) - Left
signs.description: Left lane ends—three lanes reducing to two.
signs.meaning:
🔢 The number of lanes reduces from three to two ahead.
⬅️ The left lane is about to end.
🚗 Prepare to merge safely to the right.

signs.name: Lane Loss (Three to Two Lanes) - Right (with 200m panel)
signs.description: Right lane ends in 200 m—space available but diminishing.
signs.meaning:
🔢 Three lanes will become two in 200 metres.
➡️ The right-hand lane is closing.
🚗 Traffic must merge to the left.

signs.name: Lane Loss (Two to One Lane) - Left
signs.description: Two lanes narrowing to single—left lane terminating.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road narrows from two lanes to a single lane.
⬅️ The left lane is ending.
🚗 All traffic must merge to the right.

signs.name: Lane Loss (Two to One Lane) - Right
signs.description: Two lanes to one—right lane ends.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Two lanes merge into one ahead.
➡️ The right lane is ending.
🚗 All traffic must merge to the left.

signs.name: Level Crossing Countdown Marker (200 m)
signs.description: 200 m to protected/unprotected level crossing.
signs.meaning:
🚆 You are approaching a railway level crossing.
📏 This marker is 200 metres from the crossing.
🐢 Prepare to slow down and possibly stop.

signs.name: Level Crossing Countdown Marker (300 m)
signs.description: 300 m advance marker for level crossing.
signs.meaning:
🚆 You are approaching a railway level crossing.
📏 This marker is 300 metres from the crossing.
👀 Be alert for warning signals.

signs.name: Level Crossing Countdown Marker 100 m
signs.description: 100 m to level crossing—imminent hazard zone.
signs.meaning:
🚆 A railway level crossing is very close.
📏 You are now 100 metres away.
🛑 Be prepared to stop for trains.

signs.name: Level Crossing With Flashing Red Signals
signs.description: Crossing protected by flashing red lights (and possibly barriers).
signs.meaning:
🚆 Warns of a railway crossing with automated signals.
🚨 Flashing red lights mean you must stop.
🚧 Barriers may also lower to block the road.

signs.name: Level Crossing With No Flashing Red Signals
signs.description: Passive/unguarded crossing relying on user observation.
signs.meaning:
🚆 Indicates a railway crossing without automatic lights or barriers.
👀 You are responsible for checking for trains.
🛑 Stop, look, and listen before crossing.

signs.name: Loop
signs.description: Circular or looping roadway geometry ahead.
signs.meaning:
🔄 Warns of a loop in the road ahead.
🐢 Reduce your speed to safely navigate the sharp curve.
↔️ Be aware of the unusual road layout.

signs.name: Low-flying Aircraft
signs.description: Sudden noise/distraction from low aircraft possible.
signs.meaning:
✈️ Be aware of low-flying aircraft in this area.
🔊 Expect sudden and loud noise.
🚗 Stay focused on the road and do not get distracted.

signs.name: Maximum Axle Weight
signs.description: Structural limit—axle load beyond stated value prohibited.
signs.meaning:
⚖️ Indicates a weight limit per axle for a bridge or road section ahead.
🚚 Vehicles exceeding this limit are prohibited.
🛑 Check your vehicle's axle weight before proceeding.

signs.name: Maximum Gross Weight (Traffic Management)
signs.description: Weight restriction for traffic management / infrastructure protection.
signs.meaning:
⚖️ Indicates a total vehicle weight restriction for this route.
🚚 This limit is for traffic management or to protect the road.
❌ Overweight vehicles must use an alternative route.

signs.name: Maximum Gross Weight
signs.description: Absolute gross weight ceiling for structure/road segment.
signs.meaning:
🌉 Indicates the absolute maximum weight for a bridge or structure.
🚚 Vehicles weighing more than the amount shown are prohibited.
⚠️ Exceeding the limit could cause structural damage.

signs.name: Maximum Vehicle Length
signs.description: Length beyond stated value cannot safely navigate ahead.
signs.meaning:
📏 Warns of a vehicle length restriction ahead.
🚚 Vehicles longer than the stated limit are prohibited.
🔄 This is usually due to sharp turns or tight spaces.

signs.name: Maximum Vehicle Width
signs.description: Restricted width (bridge, chicane, narrowing) ahead.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Warns of a width restriction ahead.
🚚 Vehicles wider than the stated limit are not allowed.
🌉 Often used for narrow bridges or lanes.

signs.name: Merging and Diverging Traffic
signs.description: Combined merge and split movements create multi‑direction conflict.
signs.meaning:
🔀 Warns of a complex junction with multiple merging and diverging lanes.
👀 Be alert for traffic changing lanes from several directions.
🐢 Reduce speed and be prepared for sudden movements.

signs.name: Merging Traffic From Left
signs.description: Additional traffic will enter from left.
signs.meaning:
🚗 Traffic will be merging from the left-hand side.
↔️ Be prepared to adjust your speed and position.
👀 Watch for vehicles entering your lane.

signs.name: Merging With Traffic From Right
signs.description: Traffic streams from right joining main flow.
signs.meaning:
🚗 Traffic will be merging from the right-hand side.
↔️ Be prepared to make space for joining vehicles.
🐢 Adjust your speed to allow for a safe merge.

signs.name: Mini Roundabout Ahead
signs.description: Small roundabout—tight geometry; right‑hand priority applies.
signs.meaning:
🔄 Warns of a mini-roundabout ahead.
➡️ Give way to traffic already on the roundabout (from your right).
🐢 Slow down due to the tight turning circle.

signs.name: Multiple Chevrons (Three) - Left
signs.description: Sharp left bend indicated by triple chevrons.
signs.meaning:
↩️ Indicates a very sharp bend to the left.
🐢 Reduce your speed significantly.
🚗 Keep to your side of the road.

signs.name: Multiple Chevrons (Three) - Right
signs.description: Sharp right bend indicated by triple chevrons.
signs.meaning:
↪️ Indicates a very sharp bend to the right.
🐢 Slow down considerably before the bend.
🚗 Stay well within your lane as you turn.

signs.name: Multiple Chevrons (Two) - Left
signs.description: Noticeable left bend with dual chevrons.
signs.meaning:
↩️ Warns of a significant bend to the left.
🐢 Adjust your speed accordingly.
👀 Follow the direction of the chevrons.

signs.name: Multiple Chevrons (Two) - Right
signs.description: Noticeable right bend with dual chevrons.
signs.meaning:
↪️ Warns of a significant bend to the right.
🐢 Reduce your speed before entering the bend.
👀 Follow the curve of the road as indicated.

signs.name: One-Lane Section
signs.description: Carriageway narrows to single lane—two‑way traffic must negotiate.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road ahead narrows to a single lane for two-way traffic.
🚗 You must give way to oncoming traffic if the obstruction is on your side.
⏳ Be prepared to stop and wait for a clear passage.

signs.name: Opening Bridge
signs.description: Movable bridge may lift for vessel passage.
signs.meaning:
🌉 Warns of a movable bridge ahead.
🚢 The bridge may open to allow boats to pass.
🛑 Be prepared to stop for lights and barriers.

signs.name: Other Hazard
signs.description: Non‑standard hazard ahead (see supplementary plate if present).
signs.meaning:
❗️ Indicates a potential hazard that is not shown on other standard signs.
ℹ️ Look for a supplementary plate below for more information.
🐢 Proceed with caution and be prepared for the unexpected.

signs.name: Overhead Electrical Cables
signs.description: Low or exposed overhead cables—risk for tall equipment or loads.
signs.meaning:
⚡️ Warns of overhead electrical cables.
🚚 High vehicles or equipment should take extreme care.
⚠️ Danger of electrocution if contact is made.

signs.name: Pedestrian Cycle Crossing
signs.description: Shared crossing for pedestrians and cyclists.
signs.meaning:
🚶 Indicates a crossing point used by both pedestrians and cyclists.
🚴 Be prepared to stop for people crossing.
🐢 Approach the crossing at a reduced speed.

signs.name: Pedestrians Crossing
signs.description: Increased likelihood of pedestrians crossing ahead.
signs.meaning:
🚶 Warns of a place where pedestrians are likely to be crossing the road.
🛑 Be prepared to slow down or stop.
👀 Watch carefully for people on or near the road.

signs.name: Pedestrians
signs.description: Pedestrians may be present or walking near the carriageway.
signs.meaning:
🚶 Be aware that pedestrians may be walking along the road.
↔️ Give them plenty of space.
🐢 Drive carefully and at a reduced speed.

signs.name: Prohibited Number of Axles
signs.description: Vehicles with a certain axle count prohibited.
signs.meaning:
🚚 Prohibits entry for vehicles with the number of axles shown.
❌ This restriction may be due to weak road structures or tight turns.
🗺️ Find an alternative route if your vehicle is affected.

signs.name: Queues Likely
signs.description: Sudden queues or stationary traffic may form.
signs.meaning:
🚗 Warns that you may encounter sudden traffic queues ahead.
🛑 Be prepared for slow-moving or stationary traffic.
↔️ Keep a safe distance from the vehicle in front.

signs.name: Restricted Headroom
signs.description: Limited vertical clearance ahead.
signs.meaning:
🌉 Warns of low overhead clearance ahead.
↕️ The maximum safe height is usually indicated.
🚚 Tall vehicles must check the height limit before proceeding.

signs.name: Risk of Grounding
signs.description: Sharp crest or dip could cause long or low vehicles to ground.
signs.meaning:
🚚 Warns that long or low vehicles are at risk of getting stuck.
⛰️ This is due to a steep hump or dip in the road.
🐢 Approach slowly to avoid damage to the underside of your vehicle.

signs.name: Road Depression
signs.description: Dip in roadway may hide hazards or ponding.
signs.meaning:
🕳️ Warns of a dip or depression in the road surface.
🐢 Reduce your speed to maintain control.
💧 Be aware of potential water pooling after rain.

signs.name: Road Divides
signs.description: Roadway splits into separated carriageways.
signs.meaning:
➗ The road ahead splits into two separate carriageways.
⬅️ Keep to the appropriate side of the physical barrier.
🚗 Prepare for a dual carriageway layout.

signs.name: Road Hump
signs.description: Speed or traffic calming hump present.
signs.meaning:
〰️ Warns of a road hump or speed bump ahead.
🐢 Slow down to avoid discomfort or damage to your vehicle.
🚗 These are used as a traffic calming measure.

signs.name: Road Narrows on Both Sides
signs.description: Symmetrical narrowing reduces lateral clearance.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road ahead narrows from both sides.
🚗 Be aware of reduced space for vehicles.
🐢 Slow down and be prepared to give way if necessary.

signs.name: Road Narrows on Left
signs.description: Left edge constricts.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road narrows on the left side ahead.
🚗 Keep to the center of your lane.
👀 Watch for cyclists or pedestrians who may have less space.

signs.name: Road Narrows on Right
signs.description: Right side narrowing reduces clearance.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road narrows on the right side ahead.
🚗 Be aware of reduced clearance.
👀 Be mindful of oncoming traffic.

signs.name: Roundabout Ahead
signs.description: Roundabout approaching; priority to traffic from right.
signs.meaning:
🔄 Warns of a roundabout ahead.
➡️ Give way to traffic approaching from your right.
🐢 Reduce your speed on approach and select the correct lane.

signs.name: School Ahead
signs.description: School zone—children may cross suddenly.
signs.meaning:
🏫 You are approaching a school.
🚸 Be extremely cautious as children may be crossing.
🐢 Drive slowly, especially during school opening and closing times.

signs.name: Series of Sharp Bends - Left
signs.description: Multiple sharp left bends ahead.
signs.meaning:
↩️ Warns of a series of bends ahead, the first of which is to the left.
🐢 Reduce your speed for the entire section.
🚗 Be prepared for multiple changes in direction.

signs.name: Series of Sharp Bends - Right
signs.description: Multiple sharp right bends.
signs.meaning:
↪️ Warns of a series of bends ahead, the first of which is to the right.
🐢 Slow down before the first bend.
🚗 Anticipate further curves and adjust your driving.

signs.name: Series of Sharp Corners - Left
signs.description: Several tight left corners.
signs.meaning:
↩️ Indicates multiple tight corners ahead, starting with a left turn.
🐢 A significant reduction in speed is required.
🚗 Be cautious of limited visibility through the corners.

signs.name: Series of Sharp Corners - Right
signs.description: Several tight right corners.
signs.meaning:
↪️ Indicates multiple tight corners ahead, starting with a right turn.
🐢 Slow down considerably before the first corner.
🚗 Maintain a safe speed throughout the series of turns.

signs.name: Sharp Bend - Left
signs.description: Pronounced left bend.
signs.meaning:
↩️ There is a sharp bend to the left ahead.
🐢 Reduce your speed before you enter the bend.
🚗 Keep well to your side of the road.

signs.name: Sharp Bend - Right
signs.description: Sharp right bend with reduced visibility.
signs.meaning:
↪️ There is a sharp bend to the right ahead.
🐢 Slow down, as visibility may be limited.
🚗 Stay in your lane throughout the bend.

signs.name: Sharp Corner - Left
signs.description: Tight left corner requiring extra speed reduction.
signs.meaning:
↩️ Indicates a tight, corner-like turn to the left.
🐢 Requires greater speed reduction than a simple bend.
👀 Be prepared for a sudden change in direction.

signs.name: Sharp Corner - Right
signs.description: Tight right corner causing sudden direction change.
signs.meaning:
↪️ Indicates a tight, corner-like turn to the right.
🐢 You must slow down significantly to navigate the corner safely.
🚗 Stay alert for the abrupt change in the road's direction.

signs.name: Sheep
signs.description: Sheep may wander or flock on roadway.
signs.meaning:
🐑 Warns that sheep may be on or near the road.
🚶 They can move unpredictably.
🐢 Slow down and be prepared to stop.

signs.name: Side Road - Left
signs.description: Side road enters from left.
signs.meaning:
↖️ Indicates a junction with a minor road joining from the left.
🚗 Be aware of traffic entering or exiting the main road.
👀 Watch for vehicles pulling out unexpectedly.

signs.name: Side Road - Right
signs.description: Side road enters from right.
signs.meaning:
↗️ Indicates a junction with a minor road joining from the right.
🚗 Be aware of traffic entering or leaving the side road.
👀 Be cautious of vehicles turning onto your road.

signs.name: Side Road on Dual C'way - (No CR Break)
signs.description: Side road joins dual carriageway without median break.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ A side road joins the dual carriageway from the left.
⛔ There is no gap in the central reserve, so traffic cannot cross.
🚗 Watch for traffic merging from the left only.

signs.name: Side Road on Dual C'way - Left (with CR Break)
signs.description: Left side entry with median gap enabling crossing.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ A side road joins from the left with a gap in the central reserve.
↔️ This allows traffic to cross the carriageway.
👀 Be alert for traffic merging left and potentially turning right across your path.

signs.name: Side Road on Dual C'way - Right (with CR Break)
signs.description: Right side entry with crossing potential.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ A side road joins from the right with a gap in the central reserve.
🚗 This allows vehicles from the other carriageway to make U-turns.
👀 Be alert for traffic crossing your path from the right.

signs.name: Side Road on Inside of Bend - Left
signs.description: Hidden left junction within bend.
signs.meaning:
⤴️ Warns of a side road on the left, on the inside of a bend.
🙈 The junction may be hidden from view until you are very close.
🐢 Reduce speed and be prepared for vehicles emerging.

signs.name: Side Road on Inside of Bend - Right
signs.description: Hidden right junction mid‑bend.
signs.meaning:
⤵️ Warns of a side road on the right, on the inside of a bend.
🙈 Visibility of the junction is restricted by the curve.
🐢 Approach the bend with caution and watch for turning traffic.

signs.name: Side Road on Outside of Bend - Left
signs.description: Left junction appears after bend exit.
signs.meaning:
⤴️ Warns of a side road on the left, on the outside of a bend.
👀 You may have a better view than if it were on the inside.
🚗 Still be cautious of traffic entering or exiting the junction.

signs.name: Side Road on Outside of Bend - Right
signs.description: Right junction emerges post‑bend.
signs.meaning:
⤵️ Warns of a side road on the right, on the outside of a bend.
🚗 Be alert for vehicles turning as you exit the curve.
🐢 Adjust your speed to approach the junction safely.

signs.name: Single Chevron - Left
signs.description: Moderate left bend (single marker).
signs.meaning:
↩️ Indicates a moderate bend to the left.
🐢 Adjust your speed and position for the curve.
🚗 Follow the direction indicated by the chevron.

signs.name: Single Chevron - Right
signs.description: Moderate right bend.
signs.meaning:
↪️ Indicates a moderate bend to the right.
🐢 Slow down to a safe speed for the curve.
🚗 Steer smoothly through the bend.

signs.name: Slippery for Cyclists
signs.description: Surface offers reduced grip to bicycle tyres.
signs.meaning:
🚴 Warns that the road surface may be slippery for cyclists.
💧 This could be due to wet leaves, metal plates, or ice.
🚗 Drivers should be extra cautious around cyclists in this area.

signs.name: Slippery Road
signs.description: Low friction surface (wet, polished, icy or contaminated).
signs.meaning:
🚗 Warns that the road ahead may be slippery.
🐢 Slow down and avoid sudden braking or sharp turns.
↔️ Increase your following distance from the vehicle in front.

signs.name: Soft Verge
signs.description: Road edge may not support vehicle weight.
signs.meaning:
🌿 The edge of the road (verge) is soft.
🚗 Avoid driving onto the verge as your vehicle could get stuck.
↔️ Keep your vehicle on the main carriageway.

signs.name: Staggered Crossroads Ahead - Left
signs.description: Two offset junctions—left arrives first.
signs.meaning:
staggered junction ahead.
⬅️ The side road on the left appears before the one on the right.
👀 Be alert for traffic from two separate minor roads.

signs.name: Staggered Crossroads Ahead - Right
signs.description: Two offset junctions—right arrives first.
signs.meaning:
staggered junction ahead.
➡️ The side road on the right appears before the one on the left.
🚗 Watch for traffic from both offset junctions.

signs.name: Staggered Crossroads Ahead at Dual C'way - Left
signs.description: Dual carriageway stagger—left junction first.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ Indicates a staggered junction on a dual carriageway.
⬅️ The side road on the left appears before the one on the right.
👀 Be alert for traffic entering and exiting from these offset junctions.

signs.name: Staggered Crossroads Ahead at Dual C'way - Right
signs.description: Dual carriageway stagger—right junction first.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ Indicates a staggered junction on a dual carriageway.
➡️ The side road on the right appears before the one on the left.
🚗 Watch for traffic from both offset junctions, especially vehicles crossing the central reserve.

signs.name: Staggered Junctions - Left Right
signs.description: Sequential junctions—left then right offset.
signs.meaning:
➕ Warns of two offset junctions ahead.
⬅️ The first junction is on the left.
➡️ The second junction is immediately after, on the right.

signs.name: Staggered Junctions - Right Left
signs.description: Sequential junctions—right then left.
signs.meaning:
➕ Warns of two offset junctions ahead.
➡️ The first junction is on the right.
⬅️ The second junction is immediately after, on the left.

signs.name: Start of Climbing Lane
signs.description: Additional uphill lane for slower vehicles.
signs.meaning:
🚚 An extra lane for slow-moving vehicles begins here on an uphill gradient.
🐢 Slower vehicles should use the left-hand lane.
🚗 Faster traffic can use the right-hand lane to overtake.

signs.name: Start of Passing Lane
signs.description: Overtaking lane provided briefly.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ An extra lane is provided ahead to allow for overtaking.
🚗 You may use the right lane to pass slower vehicles.
🔚 Be aware that the overtaking lane will end a short distance ahead.

signs.name: Steep Ascent
signs.description: Strong uphill gradient demands power.
signs.meaning:
📈 Warns of a steep uphill slope ahead.
⚙️ You may need to change to a lower gear.
🚚 Be aware of slow-moving heavy vehicles.

signs.name: Steep Descent
signs.description: Significant downhill gradient—brake fade risk.
signs.meaning:
📉 Warns of a steep downhill slope ahead.
⚙️ Select a low gear to use engine braking.
 brakes to avoid overheating.

signs.name: Stop Ahead
signs.description: Mandatory STOP line or sign soon.
signs.meaning:
🛑 Prepare to stop at a junction ahead.
🚗 This gives you advance warning of an upcoming 'STOP' sign.
🐢 Slow down and be ready to come to a complete stop.

signs.name: T Junction (Major Road) Ahead
signs.description: T‑junction meets major priority road.
signs.meaning:
T-junction ahead where you must give way.
🚗 Traffic on the major road has priority.
🛑 Be prepared to stop before joining the main road.

signs.name: T Junction Ahead at Dual C'way (No CR Break)
signs.description: T‑junction into dual carriageway lacking median opening.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The road ahead joins a dual carriageway at a T-junction.
⬅️ You will only be able to turn left.
⛔ There is no gap in the central reserve to turn right.

signs.name: T Junction Ahead at Dual C'way (With CR Break)
signs.description: T‑junction with central reserve gap.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The road ahead joins a dual carriageway at a T-junction.
↔️ There is a gap in the central reserve.
🚗 This allows you to turn right, but be extremely careful of fast-moving traffic.

signs.name: T-Junction (Type 1) - Left
signs.description: Left approach forming T.
signs.meaning:
T-junction where a road joins from the left.
🚗 Be aware of traffic entering from the side road.
👀 Proceed with caution.

signs.name: T-Junction (Type 1) - Right
signs.description: Right approach forming T.
signs.meaning:
T-junction where a road joins from the right.
🚗 Be aware of traffic entering from the side road.
👀 Proceed with caution.

signs.name: T-Junction (Type 2) - Left
signs.description: Left variant T‑junction geometry.
signs.meaning:
T-junction with a specific layout.
🚗 The side road joins from the left.
🛑 Prepare to give way to traffic on the major road.

signs.name: T-Junction (Type 2) - Right
signs.description: Right variant T‑junction geometry.
signs.meaning:
T-junction with a specific layout.
🚗 The side road joins from the right.
🛑 Prepare to give way to traffic on the major road.

signs.name: Three Lanes of Traffic (One With, Two Against)
signs.description: Three-lane layout adverse to your direction (one your way, two opposing).
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road ahead has three lanes in total.
➡️ You have one lane in your direction.
⬅️ There are two lanes of oncoming traffic.

signs.name: Three Lanes of Traffic (Two With, One Against)
signs.description: Two lanes favour your direction; one oncoming.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road ahead has three lanes in total.
➡️ You have two lanes in your direction.
⬅️ There is one lane of oncoming traffic.

signs.name: Tractors
signs.description: Slow agricultural vehicles possible.
signs.meaning:
🚜 Be aware of slow-moving tractors or other farm vehicles.
⏳ Be patient and prepare to slow down.
↔️ Only overtake when it is safe to do so.

signs.name: Traffic Signals
signs.description: Signal-controlled junction ahead.
signs.meaning:
🚦 Warns of traffic lights at the junction ahead.
🛑 Be prepared to stop if the lights are red or amber.
🚗 Slow down on approach.

signs.name: Tram Advisory Speed
signs.description: Suggested max tram speed for section.
signs.meaning:
🚋 This sign is for tram drivers.
 advises the maximum safe speed for the tram.
🚗 Car drivers should be aware of tram movements.

signs.name: Tram Crossing
signs.description: Tram track crosses or merges with road alignment.
signs.meaning:
🚋 Warns that a tram line crosses the road ahead.
🛤️ Be aware of the tracks, which can be slippery for cyclists and motorcyclists.
🛑 Be prepared to stop for trams.

signs.name: Tunnel
signs.description: Enclosed tunnel environment ahead with altered lighting/ventilation.
signs.meaning:
🚇 You are approaching a tunnel.
💡 Turn on your dipped headlights before entering.
🕶️ Remove sunglasses for better visibility.

signs.name: Two Junctions on Left
signs.description: Two closely spaced left-side junctions.
signs.meaning:
↖️ Warns of two side roads on the left, very close together.
🚗 Be aware of traffic entering or exiting from both junctions.
👀 Proceed with extra caution.

signs.name: Two Junctions on Right
signs.description: Two closely spaced right-side junctions.
signs.meaning:
↗️ Warns of two side roads on the right, very close together.
🚗 Be aware of traffic from both junctions.
👀 Watch for vehicles turning across your path.

signs.name: Two-Lane Section
signs.description: Road has or resumes two-lane configuration.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Indicates the start of a two-lane road.
🚗 There is one lane in each direction.
🛣️ This may be the start of a new road type or the end of a single-lane section.

signs.name: Two-way Traffic Crossing
signs.description: Two-way traffic route crosses ahead.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Warns that you are about to cross a road with two-way traffic.
🚗 This is often used when exiting a one-way system.
👀 Look for traffic from both left and right.

signs.name: Two-way Traffic
signs.description: Start of opposing two-way traffic after separated section.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road ahead has two-way traffic.
🚗 You will now face oncoming vehicles.
🛣️ This usually marks the end of a dual carriageway or one-way street.

signs.name: Uneven Road
signs.description: Irregular surface may disrupt vehicle stability.
signs.meaning:
〰️ The road surface ahead is bumpy or uneven.
🐢 Reduce your speed to maintain control and for a smoother ride.
🚗 Keep a firm grip on the steering wheel.

signs.name: Unprotected Water
signs.description: Water body close without barrier.
signs.meaning:
🌊 The road is close to a river, canal, or deep water without a safety barrier.
🚗 Drive with extreme caution, especially in bad weather.
⚠️ Be mindful of the risk of entering the water.

signs.name: Y-Junction - Left
signs.description: Y-shaped junction with left branch.
signs.meaning:
Y-shaped junction ahead.
🚗 Traffic from two separate roads merges.
↔️ Be aware of traffic joining from the other branch.

signs.name: Y-Junction- Right
signs.description: Y-shaped junction with right branch.
signs.meaning:
Y-shaped junction ahead.
🚗 Traffic from two converging roads will merge.
↔️ Be prepared for vehicles joining from the other branch.

signs.name: Yield Ahead
signs.description: Advance notice of a yield sign.
signs.meaning:
🔽 Prepare to give way (yield) at the junction ahead.
🚗 This sign gives advance warning of a 'Yield' line.
🐢 Slow down and be ready to stop if necessary.

signs.name: Bus Stop
signs.description: Designated stopping area for buses.
signs.meaning:
🚌 Indicates a designated bus stop.
🅿️ Do not park or stop your vehicle here, as it will obstruct the bus.
🚶 Be aware of passengers getting on or off the bus.

signs.name: Clearway
signs.description: No stopping or parking during stated times to keep route clear.
signs.meaning:
🚫 No stopping or parking on the main carriageway.
⏰ This restriction usually applies 24/7.
🚗 You may only stop briefly to pick up or set down passengers.

signs.name: Contra-Flow Bus Lane
signs.description: Bus lane running opposite to general traffic direction.
signs.meaning:
🚌 Indicates a bus lane where buses travel in the opposite direction to other traffic.
⛔ Do not enter this lane.
⚠️ Be aware of oncoming buses.

signs.name: Contra-flow Cycle Track
signs.description: Cycle track operating opposite general traffic direction.
signs.meaning:
🚲 Indicates a cycle lane where cyclists travel against the main flow of traffic.
🚗 Be extra vigilant for cyclists, especially when turning.
⛔ Do not drive or park in this lane.

signs.name: Electric Vehicle Parking Permitted
signs.description: Space reserved for electric vehicles.
signs.meaning:
🔌 This parking space is reserved for electric vehicles.
🅿️ Often, the vehicle must be actively charging.
🚗 Non-electric vehicles are not permitted to park here.

signs.name: Go (Manual Control)
signs.description: Manually controlled signal instructs traffic may proceed.
signs.meaning:
🟢 You may proceed with caution.
👷 This sign is manually operated by a traffic controller.
🚗 Obey the sign holder's instructions.

signs.name: Géill Slí (Yield sign in Irish)
signs.description: Irish-language yield sign indicating give way priority.
signs.meaning:
🔽 'Géill Slí' means 'Yield' or 'Give Way' in Irish.
🚗 You must give way to traffic on the major road ahead.
🛑 Be prepared to stop if necessary.

signs.name: Height Restriction
signs.description: Maximum vehicle height permitted under structure.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Vehicles taller than the height shown are prohibited.
🌉 This restriction is usually for a low bridge, tunnel, or car park.
🚚 Drivers of high vehicles must find an alternative route.

signs.name: Keep Left
signs.description: Mandatory direction—pass on left side or stay left.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ You must keep to the left of this sign.
🚧 This is a compulsory instruction, often used to pass an island or obstruction.
🚗 Do not pass on the right.

signs.name: Keep Right
signs.description: Mandatory keep or pass to right instruction.
signs.meaning:
➡️ You must keep to the right of this sign.
🚧 This is a mandatory instruction, used to safely pass an obstruction.
🚗 Do not pass on the left.

signs.name: Keep Straight Ahead
signs.description: Mandatory straight movement—turns prohibited here.
signs.meaning:
⬆️ You must proceed straight ahead only.
⛔ Turning left or right at this junction is prohibited.
🚗 Follow the mandatory direction.

signs.name: LRT Speed Limit
signs.description: Maximum permitted speed for light rail transit vehicles.
signs.meaning:
🚋 This sign indicates a mandatory speed limit for trams only.
🚗 It does not apply to regular road traffic.
🔢 The speed is shown in km/h.

signs.name: LRT Stop
signs.description: Mandatory stop point for light rail transit vehicles.
signs.meaning:
🚋 Tram drivers must stop at this sign.
🛑 This is a mandatory instruction for trams.
🚗 It does not apply to other vehicles.

signs.name: LRT Yield
signs.description: Light rail transit must give way to specified traffic.
signs.meaning:
🚋 Tram drivers must give way (yield) to other traffic.
🔽 This sign is for tram operators only.
🚗 Be aware of tram movements, but they should be yielding to you.

signs.name: Maximum Axle Weight
signs.description: Axle load limit to protect structure or road.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Vehicles with an axle weight exceeding the amount shown are prohibited.
⚖️ This is to protect weak bridges or road surfaces.
🚚 Check your vehicle's specifications before proceeding.

signs.name: Maximum Gross Weight (Traffic Management)
signs.description: Gross weight cap for flow or protection.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Vehicles with a total weight exceeding the amount shown are prohibited.
⚖️ This is often used to keep heavy traffic out of residential areas.
🗺️ Find an alternative route if your vehicle is overweight.

signs.name: Maximum Gross Weight
signs.description: Structural gross weight limit.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Vehicles with a total weight exceeding the amount shown are prohibited.
🌉 This is a structural limit, typically for a weak bridge.
🚚 Exceeding this limit is dangerous and illegal.

signs.name: Maximum Vehicle Length
signs.description: Length limit due to geometry constraints.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Vehicles longer than the length shown are prohibited.
🔄 This is usually due to tight turns or narrow spaces ahead.
🚚 Drivers of long vehicles must find an alternative route.

signs.name: Maximum Vehicle Width
signs.description: Width restriction enforced ahead.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Vehicles wider than the width shown are prohibited.
↔️ This restriction is often for a narrow lane, bridge, or gate.
🚚 Drivers of wide vehicles must not proceed.

signs.name: Mini Roundabout
signs.description: Mini roundabout—priority to right circulating traffic.
signs.meaning:
🔄 You are at a mini-roundabout.
➡️ Give way to traffic from your right.
🚗 Drive over the painted circle if necessary, but only if it is safe.

signs.name: Nearside Tram Lane
signs.description: Tram-dedicated lane on nearside of carriageway.
signs.meaning:
🚋 Indicates a tram-only lane on the left side of the road.
⛔ Other vehicles are not permitted in this lane.
⏰ The restriction may be full-time or at specific times shown on a plate.

signs.name: Nearside With-flow Bus Lane
signs.description: Left-side bus lane moving with general traffic.
signs.meaning:
🚌 The left-hand lane is a bus lane.
⏰ Do not drive in it during the hours of operation shown.
🏍️ Cyclists and taxis may also be permitted.

signs.name: No Cycles
signs.description: Bicycles prohibited on this road or path.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Cycling is not allowed beyond this point.
🚲 This applies to all types of bicycles.
🚶 Cyclists must dismount and walk or use an alternative route.

signs.name: No Entry
signs.description: All vehicular entry prohibited from this direction.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Do not enter.
🚫 Vehicular traffic is prohibited from entering this road.
➡️ This is often used to indicate a one-way street or an exit-only.

signs.name: No Horse and Carts
signs.description: Horse-drawn vehicles prohibited.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Horse-drawn vehicles are not allowed on this road.
🐴 This restriction is mandatory.
🗺️ Find an alternative route.

signs.name: No Left Turn
signs.description: Left turn manoeuvre prohibited.
signs.meaning:
⛔ You are not allowed to turn left at this junction.
⬅️ This is a mandatory instruction.
🚗 Proceed straight ahead or turn right if permitted.

signs.name: No Overtaking
signs.description: Overtaking manoeuvres prohibited in this stretch.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Overtaking other vehicles is prohibited.
🚗 Do not cross the solid white line if present.
🔚 This restriction applies until you see the 'End of No Overtaking' sign.

signs.name: No Parking
signs.description: Parking prohibited in this area.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Parking your vehicle is not allowed in this area.
⏰ Restrictions may apply at certain times, as shown on a supplementary plate.
🚗 You may be allowed to stop briefly to pick up or drop off passengers.

signs.name: No Pedestrians
signs.description: Pedestrian access prohibited for safety.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Pedestrians are not allowed beyond this point.
🚶 This is usually for safety reasons, such as on a motorway.
🗺️ Pedestrians must use an alternative route.

signs.name: No Ridden or Accompanied Horses
signs.description: Ridden or led horses prohibited.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Ridden or led horses are not allowed on this road or path.
🐴 This restriction is for the safety of both horses and other road users.
🗺️ Equestrians must find an alternative route.

signs.name: No Right Turn
signs.description: Right turn manoeuvre prohibited.
signs.meaning:
⛔ You are not allowed to turn right at this junction.
➡️ This is a mandatory instruction.
🚗 Proceed straight ahead or turn left if permitted.

signs.name: No Straight Ahead
signs.description: Continuing straight is forbidden.
signs.meaning:
⛔ You cannot go straight ahead at this junction.
⬆️ This is a mandatory instruction.
↔️ You must turn left or right.

signs.name: No U-Turn
signs.description: U-turn manoeuvre prohibited at location.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Making a U-turn (a 180-degree turn) is prohibited here.
↩️ This is for safety reasons, often due to high traffic or limited visibility.
🚗 Continue to a safer place to turn around.

signs.name: No Vehicles Carrying Explosives
signs.description: Vehicles transporting explosive materials prohibited.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Vehicles carrying explosives or flammable materials are prohibited.
💥 This is usually for safety in tunnels or built-up areas.
🗺️ These vehicles must follow a designated alternative route.

signs.name: Offside Tram Lane
signs.description: Tram-only lane on offside of carriageway.
signs.meaning:
🚋 The right-hand or center lane is for trams only.
⛔ Other traffic must not enter this lane.
⏰ Check for signs indicating the hours of operation.

signs.name: Offside With-flow Bus Lane
signs.description: Right-side bus lane moving in same direction as general traffic.
signs.meaning:
🚌 The right-hand (center) lane is a bus lane.
⏰ Do not drive in this lane during its hours of operation.
🚗 Stay in the unrestricted lanes.

signs.name: Parking Permitted
signs.description: Parking allowed subject to local plate restrictions.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Parking is allowed in this area.
ℹ️ Check for supplementary plates that may indicate time limits, fees, or permit requirements.
🚗 Park your vehicle within marked bays where provided.

signs.name: Pass Either Side
signs.description: Obstacle may be passed on either left or right.
signs.meaning:
↔️ You may pass the obstruction ahead on either the left or the right side.
🚧 This sign is usually found at the start of a traffic island or roadworks.
🚗 Choose the safest and clearest path.

signs.name: Pedal Cycles Only
signs.description: Path or lane reserved exclusively for pedal cycles.
signs.meaning:
🚲 This route is for pedal cycles only.
⛔ No pedestrians or motor vehicles are allowed.
🛣️ Indicates the start of a mandatory cycle track.

signs.name: Pedestrian Crossing
signs.description: Marked crossing where pedestrians have priority when on crossing.
signs.meaning:
🚶 Indicates a marked pedestrian crossing (zebra crossing) ahead.
🛑 You must give way to pedestrians who are on the crossing.
🐢 Approach with caution and be prepared to stop.

signs.name: Pedestrianised Street
signs.description: Street restricted to pedestrian use.
signs.meaning:
🚶 You are entering a pedestrianized zone.
⛔ Motor vehicles are prohibited.
⏰ Access may be permitted for deliveries at certain times, check local signs.

signs.name: Prohibited Axles in Right Hand Lane
signs.description: Certain axle configurations barred from right lane.
signs.meaning:
🚚 Vehicles with 3 or more axles are not allowed in the right-hand lane.
➡️ This is often seen on motorways with steep gradients.
🚛 HGVs and other large vehicles must use the left/center lanes.

signs.name: Prohibited Number of Axles
signs.description: Vehicles exceeding specified axle count prohibited.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Vehicles with more than the specified number of axles are prohibited.
🚚 This restriction may be due to weak road structures or sharp turns.
🗺️ Affected vehicles must use an alternative route.

signs.name: Restriction on Parking – Specified Events
signs.description: Parking restricted during posted events or times.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Parking is restricted here, but only during specific events.
🏟️ This is common near stadiums or event venues.
ℹ️ Check the supplementary plate for details on which events the restriction applies to.

signs.name: Rural Speed Limit
signs.description: Posted maximum rural road speed.
signs.meaning:
🔚 The previous speed limit has ended.
🚗 The national speed limit for this type of road now applies.
ℹ️ For cars, this is typically 80 km/h on rural roads.

signs.name: School Warden
signs.description: Patrol may halt traffic for child crossing.
signs.meaning:
🚸 Warns that a school traffic warden may be operating ahead.
🛑 You must stop when the warden displays their 'STOP' sign.
🐢 Drive slowly and be prepared to stop for children crossing.

signs.name: Segregated Route for Pedal Cycles and Pedestrians (Cycle on Left)
signs.description: Segregated path—cycle lane left, pedestrians right.
signs.meaning:
↔️ A shared path for cyclists and pedestrians, with separate lanes for each.
🚲 Cyclists must use the left-hand side.
🚶 Pedestrians must use the right-hand side.

signs.name: Segregated Route for Pedal Cycles and Pedestrians (Cycle on Right)
signs.description: Segregated path—cycle lane on right side.
signs.meaning:
↔️ A shared path with separate lanes for cyclists and pedestrians.
🚲 Cyclists must use the right-hand side.
🚶 Pedestrians must use the left-hand side.

signs.name: Shared Route for Pedal Cycles and Pedestrians
signs.description: Mixed-use path shared by cyclists and pedestrians.
signs.meaning:
🤝 An unsegregated route to be shared by both cyclists and pedestrians.
🚲 Cyclists should be courteous to pedestrians.
🚶 Pedestrians should be aware of cyclists.

signs.name: Speed Limit 100 km
signs.description: Maximum legal speed 100 km/h.
signs.meaning:
💯 The maximum permitted speed is 100 kilometres per hour.
🚗 Do not exceed this speed limit.
🛣️ This limit typically applies to high-quality dual carriageways.

signs.name: Speed Limit 120 km
signs.description: Maximum legal speed 120 km/h.
signs.meaning:
💨 The maximum permitted speed is 120 kilometres per hour.
🚗 This is the highest speed limit and applies only to motorways.
🛣️ Do not exceed this speed.

signs.name: Speed Limit 20 km
signs.description: Very low-speed environment.
signs.meaning:
🐢 The maximum permitted speed is 20 kilometres per hour.
🚗 This very low limit is used in areas with high pedestrian activity.
🚶 Drive with extreme caution.

signs.name: Speed Limit 30 km
signs.description: Maximum speed limit of 30 km/h.
signs.meaning:
🐢 The maximum permitted speed is 30 kilometres per hour.
🏘️ Often used in residential areas or near schools.
🚶 Drive slowly and be prepared to stop.

signs.name: Speed Limit 40 km
signs.description: Reduced speed limit area.
signs.meaning:
🐢 The maximum permitted speed is 40 kilometres per hour.
🚗 This is a reduced speed limit, so slow down.
🚦 Used in areas where a lower speed is safer.

signs.name: Speed Limit 50 km
signs.description: Standard urban limit.
signs.meaning:
5️⃣0️⃣ The maximum permitted speed is 50 kilometres per hour.
🏘️ This is the standard speed limit in built-up areas unless otherwise indicated.
🚗 Do not exceed this speed.

signs.name: Speed Limit 60 km
signs.description: Transitional speed zone.
signs.meaning:
6️⃣0️⃣ The maximum permitted speed is 60 kilometres per hour.
🚗 This is often used as a transition between a higher and lower speed zone.
🐢 Adjust your speed accordingly.

signs.name: Speed Limit 80 km
signs.description: Typical rural single-carriageway limit.
signs.meaning:
8️⃣0️⃣ The maximum permitted speed is 80 kilometres per hour.
🚗 This is the typical limit for rural, single-carriageway roads.
🛣️ Do not exceed this speed, and drive slower if conditions require it.

signs.name: Stop (Manual Control)
signs.description: Manual controller requires a full stop.
signs.meaning:
🛑 You must stop here.
👷 This sign is manually operated by a traffic controller.
🚗 Do not proceed until you are instructed to do so.

signs.name: Stop
signs.description: Mandatory full stop at line.
signs.meaning:
🛑 You must come to a complete stop at the junction line.
🚗 Do not proceed until the way is clear.
👀 This is a mandatory instruction, not optional.

signs.name: Taxi Stand
signs.description: Designated taxi waiting or boarding area.
signs.meaning:
🚖 This area is reserved for taxis only.
🅿️ Other vehicles are not permitted to park or wait here.
🧍 This is a designated area for hiring a taxi.

signs.name: Turn Left Ahead
signs.description: Mandatory left turn upcoming.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ You must turn left at the next junction.
🚗 This is an advance warning of a compulsory turn.
🛣️ No other movements are permitted.

signs.name: Turn Left
signs.description: Immediate mandatory left turn.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ You must turn left at this junction.
🚗 This is a compulsory instruction.
⛔ Going straight or turning right is not allowed.

signs.name: Turn Right Ahead
signs.description: Mandatory right turn shortly ahead.
signs.meaning:
➡️ You must turn right at the next junction.
🚗 This is an advance warning of a compulsory turn.
🛣️ No other movements are permitted.

signs.name: Turn Right
signs.description: Immediate mandatory right turn.
signs.meaning:
➡️ You must turn right at this junction.
🚗 This is a compulsory instruction.
⛔ Going straight or turning left is not allowed.

signs.name: Téigh (Manual Control)
signs.description: Irish-language manual instruction to proceed.
signs.meaning:
🟢 'Téigh' means 'Go' in the Irish language.
👷 You may proceed when shown this manually operated sign.
🚗 Follow the instructions of the traffic controller.

signs.name: Yield
signs.description: Give way to traffic on the priority road.
signs.meaning:
🔽 You must give way to traffic on the major road ahead.
🚗 Let crossing traffic pass before you proceed.
🛑 Be prepared to stop if necessary.

signs.name: Convoy System in Operation
signs.description: Traffic guided through works by lead vehicle convoy.
signs.meaning:
🚗 A convoy system is in use to guide traffic through the roadworks.
🛑 Wait for the official pilot vehicle.
➡️ Follow the 'Follow Me' vehicle and do not overtake it.

signs.name: Cyclists Keep Left
signs.description: Cyclists directed to keep left in works zone.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ Cyclists must keep to the left through the roadworks.
🚴 Follow the temporary route provided.
🚧 Be aware of construction and uneven surfaces.

signs.name: Cyclists Keep Right
signs.description: Cyclists directed to keep right in special layout.
signs.meaning:
➡️ Cyclists must keep to the right through the roadworks.
🚴 Follow the temporary route provided.
🚧 Be aware of construction and uneven surfaces.

signs.name: Detour Destination
signs.description: Indicates end destination of signed detour route.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ This sign indicates the final destination of the current detour.
➡️ Follow signs for this destination to stay on the correct diversion route.
✅ Helps confirm you are following the right path.

signs.name: Detour
signs.description: Official diversion around closure or works.
signs.meaning:
↪️ Indicates the start of a mandatory diversion due to roadworks or a closure.
🗺️ Follow the signed detour route to get around the obstruction.
🛑 Your original route is not accessible.

signs.name: Diverted Traffic (Left)
signs.description: Detoured traffic directed left.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ Traffic on the detour route must turn left at this junction.
🗺️ Follow the direction to stay on the official diversion.
🚧 This is part of the temporary route.

signs.name: Diverted Traffic (Right)
signs.description: Detoured traffic directed right.
signs.meaning:
➡️ Traffic on the detour route must turn right at this junction.
🗺️ Follow the arrow to continue on the diversion.
🚧 This is part of a temporary route due to roadworks.

signs.name: Diverted Traffic (Straight)
signs.description: Detour continues straight ahead.
signs.meaning:
⬆️ The detour route continues straight on at this junction.
🗺️ Do not turn; follow the main path of the diversion.
🚧 Continue ahead to bypass the roadworks.

signs.name: Diverted Traffic (Upper Left)
signs.description: Diversion takes upper-left trajectory.
signs.meaning:
↖️ The detour route requires you to bear left ahead.
🗺️ Follow the indicated direction to stay on the diversion.
🚧 This keeps traffic flowing around the works area.

signs.name: Diverted Traffic (Upper Right)
signs.description: Diversion directs upper-right path.
signs.meaning:
↗️ The detour route requires you to bear right ahead.
🗺️ Follow the indicated path to continue on the diversion.
🚧 This temporary route bypasses the main road closure.

signs.name: End of Central Reserve or Obstruction
signs.description: Taper end where central obstruction finishes.
signs.meaning:
🔚 The obstruction or work area in the middle of the road has ended.
🚗 Traffic can return to its normal lanes.
✅ The roadway is now clear of the central obstruction.

signs.name: End of Detour
signs.description: Diversion route terminates; normal routing resumes.
signs.meaning:
✅ The temporary detour has finished.
🗺️ You can now rejoin your original route.
🚗 Normal road conditions resume ahead.

signs.name: End of Obstruction Between Lanes
signs.description: Central obstruction removed; lanes regularize.
signs.meaning:
🔚 The obstruction that was separating lanes has ended.
🚗 Traffic no longer needs to pass on either side.
↔️ Lanes return to their normal configuration.

signs.name: Flagman Ahead
signs.description: Human controller operating traffic flow ahead.
signs.meaning:
👷 Warns that a traffic controller (flagman) is ahead.
🛑 Be prepared to stop or follow their instructions.
🐢 Slow down and approach with caution.

signs.name: Follow Me
signs.description: Lead vehicle guiding safe path through works.
signs.meaning:
🚗 You must follow a lead vehicle through the work zone.
 convoy.
🚧 This ensures a safe passage through a hazardous area.

signs.name: Free Recovery End
signs.description: End of zone offering free breakdown recovery.
signs.meaning:
✅ The area with free breakdown recovery service has ended.
🚗 You are now responsible for your own recovery arrangements.
🔚 Normal motorway rules apply.

signs.name: Free Recovery
signs.description: Zone where breakdown recovery is free.
signs.meaning:
🛠️ Indicates the start of a zone with a free recovery service.
🚗 If you break down in this area, assistance will be provided.
🛑 Do not stop unless it is an emergency.

signs.name: Hump or Ramp
signs.description: Raised surface for speed control.
signs.meaning:
〰️ Warns of a temporary hump or ramp on the road.
🐢 Slow down to drive over it safely.
🚧 These are often used to control speed through work zones.

signs.name: Lane 1 of 2 Closed (Level 1)
signs.description: Left lane of two closed ahead level 1 layout.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The left lane of a two-lane road is closed ahead.
➡️ Traffic must merge into the right lane.
🐢 Reduce your speed and prepare to merge.

signs.name: Lane 1 of 2 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Left lane of two closed complex layout.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The left lane is closed ahead on a two-lane road.
➡️ All traffic must use the right lane.
🚦 Indicates a more complex roadwork layout.

signs.name: Lane 1 of 2 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major lane closure left of two lanes.
signs.meaning:
🚧 Major roadworks have closed the left lane.
➡️ Merge to the right in good time.
🐢 Expect potential delays.

signs.name: Lane 1 of 3 Closed (Level 1)
signs.description: Left lane 1 of 3 closed.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The left lane of a three-lane road is closed ahead.
➡️ Traffic should merge into the center or right lanes.
🐢 Be aware of merging traffic.

signs.name: Lane 1 of 3 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Left lane closure in complex level 3 setup.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The left lane of three is closed ahead due to complex roadworks.
➡️ Move out of the left lane.
🚦 Be prepared for a more intricate traffic management setup.

signs.name: Lane 1 of 3 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major lane closure of left lane.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The left lane is closed due to major roadworks.
➡️ Traffic must use the two right-hand lanes.
🐢 Merge in good time and expect delays.

signs.name: Lane 1 of 4 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Leftmost lane of four closed complex layout.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The far left lane of a four-lane road is closed ahead.
➡️ Prepare to merge into the three available lanes to the right.
🚦 This indicates a complex roadwork zone.

signs.name: Lane 1 of 4 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major closure left lane of four.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The left lane is closed on a four-lane road for major works.
➡️ Traffic must use the three right-hand lanes.
🐢 Merge right and be prepared for slower traffic.

signs.name: Lane 2 of 2 Closed (Level 1)
signs.description: Right lane of two closed ahead.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The right lane of a two-lane road is closed ahead.
⬅️ All traffic must merge into the left lane.
🐢 Slow down and prepare to merge.

signs.name: Lane 2 of 2 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Right lane closed complex layout.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The right lane is closed ahead in a complex roadwork zone.
⬅️ All traffic must use the left lane.
🚦 Follow instructions and be aware of the changed layout.

signs.name: Lane 2 of 2 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major closure of right lane.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The right lane is closed for major roadworks.
⬅️ Traffic must merge into the left lane.
🐢 Expect potential delays and merge in turn.

signs.name: Lane 2 of 2 Narrow (advance)
signs.description: Both lanes narrowing soon.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Both lanes of the two-lane carriageway will narrow ahead.
🐢 Reduce your speed.
🚗 Be aware of reduced space and keep centered in your lane.

signs.name: Lane 2 of 2 Narrow
signs.description: Narrow section now active.
signs.meaning:
↔️ You are now in the section where both lanes are narrow.
🚗 Proceed with caution and maintain a safe distance.
🚧 This is due to roadworks at the side of the road.

signs.name: Lane 3 of 3 Closed (Level 1)
signs.description: Rightmost lane 3 of 3 closed.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The right lane of a three-lane road is closed ahead.
⬅️ Traffic must use the center and left lanes.
🐢 Prepare to merge left if you are in the right lane.

signs.name: Lane 3 of 3 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Complex closure right lane 3 of 3.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The right lane is closed due to a complex roadwork layout.
⬅️ Move into the center or left lanes.
🚦 Be alert for changes in the road configuration.

signs.name: Lane 3 of 3 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major closure right lane 3 of 3.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The right lane is closed for major roadworks.
⬅️ Traffic should merge into the two available left lanes.
🐢 Merge in good time and expect slower traffic.

signs.name: Lane 3 of 3 Narrow (advance)
signs.description: All three lanes will narrow ahead.
signs.meaning:
↔️ All three lanes of the carriageway will narrow ahead.
🐢 Reduce your speed.
🚗 Be mindful of the reduced road width.

signs.name: Lane 3 of 3 Narrow
signs.description: Narrow three-lane section active.
signs.meaning:
↔️ You are now in the section with three narrow lanes.
🚗 Drive with caution and stay centered in your lane.
🚧 Roadworks are present at the side.

signs.name: Lane 4 of 4 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Far right lane of four closed complex layout.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The far right lane of a four-lane road is closed.
⬅️ Traffic must use the three available left lanes.
🚦 Be prepared for a complex roadwork layout ahead.

signs.name: Lane 4 of 4 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major closure of lane 4 of 4.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The right lane is closed on a four-lane road for major works.
⬅️ Merge left into one of the three open lanes.
🐢 Anticipate slower traffic and merge early.

signs.name: Lanes 1 & 2 of 3 Closed (Level 1)
signs.description: Left and centre lanes closed only right lane open.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The left and center lanes of a three-lane road are closed.
➡️ All traffic must merge into the single right lane.
🐢 Expect significant delays and merge early.

signs.name: Lanes 1 & 2 of 3 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Complex closure of lanes 1 and 2.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The two left lanes are closed ahead in a complex roadwork zone.
➡️ All traffic must use the far right lane.
🚦 Be prepared for a significant change in road layout.

signs.name: Lanes 1 & 2 of 3 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major closure leaving only right lane.
signs.meaning:
🚧 Major roadworks have closed the left and center lanes.
➡️ Traffic must merge into the single right-hand lane.
🐢 Expect queues and merge in turn.

signs.name: Lanes 1 & 2 of 4 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Left two lanes closed on four-lane road.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The two left-hand lanes of a four-lane road are closed.
➡️ Traffic must use the two available lanes on the right.
🚦 Follow instructions for the complex traffic management.

signs.name: Lanes 1 & 2 of 4 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major closure removing lanes 1 and 2.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The two left lanes are closed for major roadworks.
➡️ Traffic must merge into the two right-hand lanes.
🐢 Prepare for reduced capacity and potential delays.

signs.name: Lanes 2 & 3 of 3 Closed (Level 1)
signs.description: Centre and right lanes closed only left open.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The center and right lanes of a three-lane road are closed.
⬅️ All traffic must merge into the single left lane.
🐢 Merge early and anticipate significant delays.

signs.name: Lanes 2 & 3 of 3 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Complex closure leaving only left lane.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The center and right lanes are closed in a complex work zone.
⬅️ All traffic is required to use the far left lane.
🚦 Follow the temporary road layout with care.

signs.name: Lanes 2 & 3 of 3 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major closure only left lane operational.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The center and right lanes are closed for major roadworks.
⬅️ Traffic must merge into the single left-hand lane.
🐢 Expect queues and merge in turn.

signs.name: Lanes 2 & 3 of 3 Narrow (advance)
signs.description: Approaching narrowing affecting centre and right lanes.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The center and right lanes of a three-lane road will narrow ahead.
🚗 Be aware of reduced width in these lanes.
🐢 Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.

signs.name: Lanes 2 & 3 of 3 Narrow
signs.description: Narrow section now affecting centre and right lanes.
signs.meaning:
↔️ You are in a section where the center and right lanes are narrow.
🚗 Drive carefully and maintain your lane position.
🚧 Roadworks are ongoing at the side.

signs.name: Lanes 3 & 4 of 4 Closed (Level 3)
signs.description: Right two lanes closed on four-lane road.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The two right-hand lanes of a four-lane road are closed.
⬅️ Traffic must use the two available lanes on the left.
🚦 Follow instructions for the complex traffic management.

signs.name: Lanes 3 & 4 of 4 Closed MLC
signs.description: Major closure removing lanes 3 and 4.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The two right lanes are closed for major roadworks.
⬅️ Traffic must merge into the two left-hand lanes.
🐢 Prepare for reduced capacity and potential delays.

signs.name: Lanes Diverge at Crossover
signs.description: Traffic lanes split at crossover alignment.
signs.meaning:
➗ Traffic lanes will split as they cross over to the other carriageway.
🚗 Ensure you are in the correct lane for your destination.
↔️ Follow the temporary lane markings carefully.

signs.name: Lanes Rejoin at Crossover
signs.description: Previously separated lanes recombine.
signs.meaning:
🤝 Traffic lanes that were separated will now rejoin.
🚗 Be aware of traffic from the adjacent lane as you merge back together.
↔️ Normal lane configuration resumes ahead.

signs.name: Loose Chippings
signs.description: Loose aggregate on surface can reduce grip and cause damage.
signs.meaning:
🪨 Warns of loose stones or gravel on the road surface.
🐢 Reduce your speed to avoid skidding or losing control.
🚗 Keep your distance from other vehicles to prevent damage from flying stones.

signs.name: Merge to the Right
signs.description: Traffic must merge right due to closure or obstruction.
signs.meaning:
➡️ Indicates that all traffic must merge to the right.
🚧 This is usually because the left lane is closed.
🚗 Merge in turn and be courteous to other drivers.

signs.name: Move to Left (One Lane)
signs.description: All traffic instructed into single left lane.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ All traffic must move into the single left-hand lane.
🚧 The road ahead is reduced to one lane.
🐢 Slow down and merge in good time.

signs.name: Move to Left (Three Lanes)
signs.description: Traffic must transition left across multiple lanes.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ Traffic in all three lanes must move to the left.
↔️ This indicates a shift in the entire carriageway alignment.
🚗 Follow the temporary road markings carefully.

signs.name: Move to Left (Two Lanes)
signs.description: Two-lane left shift required.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ Traffic in both lanes must move to the left.
↔️ The road layout ahead shifts to the left.
🚗 Stay in your lane and follow the new alignment.

signs.name: Move to Right (One Lane)
signs.description: All traffic consolidates into single right lane.
signs.meaning:
➡️ All traffic must move into the single right-hand lane.
🚧 The road ahead is reduced to one lane.
🐢 Slow down and prepare to merge.

signs.name: Move to Right (Three Lanes)
signs.description: Multi-lane rightward move required.
signs.meaning:
➡️ Traffic in all three lanes must move to the right.
↔️ The entire carriageway is shifting to the right.
🚗 Follow the temporary lane markings and cones.

signs.name: Move to Right (Two Lanes)
signs.description: Two-lane right shift mandated.
signs.meaning:
➡️ Traffic in both lanes must move to the right.
↔️ The road alignment shifts to the right.
🚗 Stay in your lane and follow the temporary path.

signs.name: Obstruction Between Lanes
signs.description: Central obstruction divides traffic flows.
signs.meaning:
🚧 There is a temporary obstruction or work area between lanes.
↔️ Traffic must pass on either the left or the right side.
🚗 Follow the markings for your lane.

signs.name: One-lane Crossover (Back)
signs.description: Single-lane crossover returning traffic alignment.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ A single lane of traffic is crossing back to the original side of the road.
🚧 This marks the end of a contraflow section.
🚗 Prepare to merge back into the normal traffic pattern.

signs.name: One-lane Crossover (Out)
signs.description: Single-lane crossover diverting traffic away.
signs.meaning:
➡️ A single lane of traffic must cross over to the other carriageway.
🚧 You are entering a contraflow system.
🚗 Follow the crossover lane carefully.

signs.name: Pedestrians Cross to Left
signs.description: Pedestrians must divert to left side crossing route.
signs.meaning:
🚶 Pedestrians must cross to the left side of the road.
🚧 The footpath ahead is closed.
↔️ Use the designated crossing point.

signs.name: Pedestrians Cross to Right
signs.description: Pedestrian diversion to right side.
signs.meaning:
🚶 Pedestrians must cross to the right side of the road.
🚧 The current footpath is closed.
↔️ Follow the temporary pedestrian route.

signs.name: Queues Likely
signs.description: High probability of queueing through works zone.
signs.meaning:
🚗 Warns that you may encounter sudden traffic queues due to roadworks.
🛑 Be prepared for slow-moving or stationary traffic.
↔️ Keep a safe distance from the vehicle in front.

signs.name: Road Closed
signs.description: Full closure ahead no through traffic.
signs.meaning:
⛔ The road ahead is closed to all traffic.
🗺️ You must use a detour or find an alternative route.
🛑 Do not proceed past this sign.

signs.name: Road Narrows on Both Sides
signs.description: Width reduced from both sides.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road ahead narrows from both sides due to roadworks.
🚗 Be aware of reduced space for vehicles.
🐢 Slow down and be prepared to give way if necessary.

signs.name: Road Narrows on Left
signs.description: Left side encroachment narrows lane.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road narrows on the left side due to roadworks.
🚗 Keep to the center of your lane.
👀 Watch for workers or equipment on the left.

signs.name: Road Narrows on Right
signs.description: Right side narrowing reduces clearance.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road narrows on the right side due to roadworks.
🚗 Be aware of reduced clearance.
👀 Be mindful of oncoming traffic and workers.

signs.name: Roadworks Ahead
signs.description: Active or upcoming roadworks zone.
signs.meaning:
🚧 Warns of roadworks ahead.
🐢 Be prepared to slow down.
👀 Watch for temporary signs, speed limits, and workers.

signs.name: Side Road on Left
signs.description: Left-side access within works area.
signs.meaning:
↖️ Indicates a side road on the left within the roadworks area.
🚗 Be aware of construction traffic entering or exiting.
👀 Approach the junction with caution.

signs.name: Side Road on Right
signs.description: Right-side junction within works zone.
signs.meaning:
↗️ Indicates a side road on the right within the roadworks area.
🚗 Be cautious of vehicles entering or leaving the site.
👀 Proceed slowly and be prepared to stop.

signs.name: Single Lane (for Shuttle Working)
signs.description: Single alternating traffic lane controlled.
signs.meaning:
↔️ The road ahead is reduced to a single lane for traffic from both directions.
🚦 Traffic flow will be controlled by temporary lights or a flagman.
⏳ Be prepared to stop and wait for your turn.

signs.name: Site Access
signs.description: Construction vehicles entering and leaving.
signs.meaning:
🚚 Warns of an entrance/exit to a construction site.
🚗 Be aware of slow-moving, large vehicles entering or leaving the roadway.
🐢 Slow down and be prepared to stop.

signs.name: Slippery for Cyclists
signs.description: Temporary surface hazardous to bicycles.
signs.meaning:
🚴 The temporary road surface may be slippery for cyclists.
🚧 This could be due to metal plates, mud, or loose material.
🚗 Drivers should give extra space to cyclists.

signs.name: Slippery Road
signs.description: Temporary works surface reduces tyre grip.
signs.meaning:
🚗 Warns that the temporary road surface may be slippery.
🐢 Slow down and avoid sudden braking or steering.
↔️ Increase your following distance.

signs.name: Soft Verge
signs.description: Verge disturbed or unstable from works.
signs.meaning:
🌿 The road edge is soft and unstable due to roadworks.
🚗 Do not drive on the verge as your vehicle may get stuck.
↔️ Keep all wheels on the paved surface.

signs.name: Start of Central Reserve or Obstruction
signs.description: Beginning of central obstruction or separation.
signs.meaning:
🚧 Indicates the start of an obstruction in the middle of the road.
↔️ Traffic must pass on the appropriate side.
🚗 Follow lane markings and be aware of the narrowed space.

signs.name: Stop Here On Red
signs.description: Mandatory stopping line for temporary signals.
signs.meaning:
🛑 When the temporary traffic light is red, you must stop at the line.
🚦 This sign accompanies temporary signals at roadworks.
🚗 Do not proceed until the light turns green.

signs.name: Temporary Pedestrian Crossing
signs.description: Temporary crossing installed within works.
signs.meaning:
🚶 Indicates a temporary crossing point for pedestrians.
🐢 Slow down and be prepared to stop for people crossing.
🚧 Be extra vigilant in the work zone.

signs.name: Temporary Traffic Signals
signs.description: Portable lights controlling flow.
signs.meaning:
🚦 Warns of temporary traffic lights ahead.
🛑 Be prepared to stop if the light is red.
🐢 These are used to control traffic flow through the roadworks.

signs.name: Two-lane Crossover (Back)
signs.description: Two-lane crossover returning traffic to original carriageway.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ Two lanes of traffic are crossing back to their normal side of the road.
🚧 This is the end of a contraflow section.
🚗 Prepare to merge with other traffic as normal layout resumes.

signs.name: Two-lane Crossover (Out)
signs.description: Two-lane crossover diverting traffic away.
signs.meaning:
➡️ Two lanes of traffic must cross over to the opposite carriageway.
🚧 You are entering a two-lane contraflow system.
🚗 Follow the crossover lanes carefully.

signs.name: Two-way Traffic
signs.description: Two-way operation reinstated in works alignment.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Indicates two-way traffic through or past the roadworks.
🚗 Be aware of oncoming vehicles in close proximity.
🚧 Stay in your lane and proceed with caution.

signs.name: Uneven Surface
signs.description: Temporary irregular surface present.
signs.meaning:
〰️ The road surface ahead is uneven due to roadworks.
🐢 Reduce your speed to maintain control and for comfort.
🚗 Be aware of potential bumps and dips.

signs.name: 60 kmh Speed Limit Ahead
signs.description: Upcoming reduction to 60 km/h limit.
signs.meaning:
🐢 Prepare to reduce your speed.
6️⃣0️⃣ A 60 km/h speed limit zone begins shortly.
🚗 Adjust your speed before entering the new zone.

signs.name: Additional Lane Joining From Left (One to Two Lanes)
signs.description: A new lane will add from left increasing capacity.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The road ahead gains an additional lane.
⬅️ A new lane begins on the left, increasing capacity from one to two lanes.
🚗 Be aware of vehicles moving into the new lane.

signs.name: Additional Lanes Joining From Left - Left Joining Lane Continues (Three to Four Lanes)
signs.description: Additional lane from left persists overall lanes increase.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The number of lanes increases from three to four.
⬅️ An additional lane joins from the left and continues as the new left lane.
🚗 Be aware of merging traffic.

signs.name: Additional Lanes Joining From Left - Left Joining Lane Continues (Three to Four Lanes)2
signs.description: Duplicate configuration left addition continues.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The road expands from three lanes to four.
⬅️ A new lane is added from the left.
🚗 Be mindful of vehicles joining from the slip road.

signs.name: Additional Lanes Joining From Left - Right Joining Lane Continues (Three to Four Lanes)
signs.description: Left additional lanes while right lane remains continuous.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The road widens from three to four lanes.
⬅️ A new lane from the left merges into the existing lanes.
🚗 Watch for traffic joining from the left.

signs.name: Additional Lanes Joining From Right (Two to Three Lanes)
signs.description: New lane adds from right side.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The road expands from two lanes to three.
➡️ A new lane joins from the right.
🚗 Be aware of merging traffic from the right-hand side.

signs.name: Additional Lanes Joining From Right - Left Joining Lane Continues (Two to Three Lanes)
signs.description: Lane count increases left lane remains continuous.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The road widens from two lanes to three.
➡️ A new lane from the right merges into the existing lanes.
🚗 Be aware of traffic joining from the right.

signs.name: Additional Lanes Joining From Right - Right Joining Lane Continues (Two to Three Lanes)
signs.description: Right-side lane addition stays.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The number of lanes increases from two to three.
➡️ A new lane joins from the right and continues as the new right lane.
🚗 Watch for traffic merging from the right.

signs.name: Airport Advance Direction
signs.description: Advance sign guiding toward airport route.
signs.meaning:
✈️ Provides advance notice for the direction to the airport.
🗺️ Helps you get into the correct lane early.
➡️ Follow the signs to ensure you take the correct exit.

signs.name: Airport Direction
signs.description: Directional sign pointing to airport.
signs.meaning:
✈️ Indicates the direction to the airport at a junction.
➡️ Follow the arrow to take the correct route.
📍 A helpful sign for travelers.

signs.name: Airport Repeater Sign
signs.description: Reassures correct route toward airport.
signs.meaning:
✈️ Confirms that you are on the correct road to the airport.
✅ Acts as a reassurance for drivers.
🛣️ Usually placed along the main route after a major junction.

signs.name: Authorised Vehicles Only
signs.description: Restricted area for authorised vehicles only.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Indicates a restricted area or access road.
🚗 Only vehicles with specific permission are allowed to enter.
❌ Unauthorized vehicles are prohibited.

signs.name: Average Speed Zone
signs.description: Cameras measure average speed over distance.
signs.meaning:
📸 You are entering an average speed camera zone.
