⏱️ Your average speed is monitored between two points.
🐢 Maintain a speed at or below the limit for the entire zone.

signs.name: Bus Parking
signs.description: Designated parking area for buses only.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Indicates a parking area reserved specifically for buses.
🚌 Other vehicles are not permitted to park here.
⛔ Unauthorized parking may result in a fine.

signs.name: Countdown Marker (motorway, 100m)
signs.description: 100 m to motorway exit or hazard.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ You are approaching a motorway exit.
📏 This marker is 100 metres from the start of the exit slip road.
↘️ If you intend to exit, ensure you are in the left-hand lane.

signs.name: Countdown Marker (motorway, 200m)
signs.description: 200 m to exit or hazard second panel.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ You are approaching a motorway exit.
📏 This marker is 200 metres from the start of the exit slip road.
↘️ Prepare to move into the exit lane.

signs.name: Countdown Marker (motorway, 300m)
signs.description: 300 m advance exit or hazard notice.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ You are approaching a motorway exit.
📏 This marker is 300 metres from the start of the exit slip road.
↘️ This is the first warning for the upcoming exit.

signs.name: County Boundary Sign (Type A)
signs.description: Entering new county Type A format.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ Indicates you are now entering a new county.
📍 Provides local geographical information.
🚗 Drive safely and respect the local area.

signs.name: County Boundary Sign (Type B)
signs.description: County boundary Type B style.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ Informs you that you have crossed into a different county.
📍 A geographical marker for drivers.
🚗 Welcome to the new county.

signs.name: Cul-de-sac
signs.description: Dead-end street no through route.
signs.meaning:
⛔ This sign indicates a dead-end street.
↔️ There is no exit at the other end.
↩️ You will need to turn around to exit.

signs.name: Cycle Parking
signs.description: Designated bicycle parking facility.
signs.meaning:
🚲 Indicates a designated parking area for bicycles.
🅿️ Cyclists can securely leave their bikes here.
📍 Often found near public transport and amenities.

signs.name: Direction Sign (regional road)
signs.description: Direction to destinations via regional route.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ Shows the direction to towns and cities from a regional road.
🛣️ White text on a green background is used for regional routes.
➡️ Follow the sign for your intended destination.

signs.name: Disabled Persons' Parking
signs.description: Reserved bay for vehicles with permit.
signs.meaning:
♿ This parking space is reserved for disabled badge holders.
🅿️ You must display a valid disabled parking permit.
⛔ Unauthorized parking is not allowed.

signs.name: e-Charging
signs.description: Electric vehicle charging point location.
signs.meaning:
🔌 Indicates the location of an electric vehicle charging station.
🚗 EV drivers can charge their vehicles here.
🔋 A vital sign for electric car users.

signs.name: Emergency (Tunnel) Lay-by
signs.description: Emergency-only stopping area inside tunnel.
signs.meaning:
🆘 Indicates an emergency stopping area inside a tunnel.
🛑 Only use this lay-by in a genuine emergency (e.g., breakdown).
🚗 Do not stop here for any other reason.

signs.name: Emergency Station
signs.description: Emergency equipment station location.
signs.meaning:
🆘 Shows the location of an emergency station.
☎️ Typically includes an emergency telephone.
🧯 May also include a fire extinguisher.

signs.name: End of Motorway Ahead
signs.description: Motorway classification ending soon.
signs.meaning:
🔚 The motorway is ending soon.
🐢 Be prepared for a change in road type and a lower speed limit.
🛣️ Normal road rules will apply shortly.

signs.name: End of Motorway
signs.description: Motorway regulations cease here.
signs.meaning:
🔚 The motorway ends here.
🛣️ Motorway regulations and restrictions no longer apply.
🐢 Be prepared for a change in speed limit and road conditions.

signs.name: Entering a Gaeltacht Area (national road, without name)
signs.description: Irish-speaking region begins signage may be Irish only.
signs.meaning:
🗣️ You are entering a 'Gaeltacht' - an Irish-speaking area.
🗺️ Place names on signs may be in the Irish language only.
🚗 Be aware of this change in signage.

signs.name: Entering a Gaeltacht Area (regional road, with name)
signs.description: Entering named Gaeltacht area on regional road.
signs.meaning:
🗣️ Indicates you are entering a named Irish-speaking (Gaeltacht) region.
🗺️ Be aware that road signs may be primarily in Irish.
🚗 Drive carefully and enjoy the local culture.

signs.name: Exit Sign (motorway)
signs.description: Indicates motorway exit location.
signs.meaning:
↘️ Marks the start of the exit slip road from a motorway.
🛣️ This is the point where you leave the main carriageway.
🚗 Ensure you are in the correct lane before this point.

signs.name: Exit Taper Gantry Sign (motorway)
signs.description: Overhead sign marking exit taper start.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ An overhead sign indicating the start of the lane for an exit.
↘️ It shows which destinations are served by this exit.
🚗 Move into the exit lane if you wish to leave the motorway.

signs.name: Fire Extinguisher and Telephone
signs.description: Emergency fire and communication equipment.
signs.meaning:
🆘 Indicates the location of emergency equipment.
🧯 A fire extinguisher is available for use.
☎️ An emergency telephone is also present.

signs.name: Fire Extinguisher, Telephone and Lay-by
signs.description: Emergency lay-by with fire and phone facilities.
signs.meaning:
🆘 This sign directs you to an emergency lay-by.
🧯 It is equipped with a fire extinguisher.
☎️ An emergency telephone is also available.

signs.name: Garda Only
signs.description: Access restricted to police vehicles.
signs.meaning:
🚓 Indicates a road or access point for police (Garda) use only.
⛔ Public and other unauthorized vehicles are not allowed.
🛑 Do not enter.

signs.name: Garda Station
signs.description: Direction or location of police station.
signs.meaning:
🚓 Indicates the direction or location of a police (Garda) station.
ℹ️ A helpful sign for the public.
➡️ Follow the sign if you need police assistance.

signs.name: Heavy Vehicle Advance Direction
signs.description: Advance route guidance for heavy vehicles.
signs.meaning:
🚚 Provides an advance warning for a specific route for heavy goods vehicles (HGVs).
🗺️ This may be to avoid a low bridge or a weight-restricted area.
➡️ HGV drivers should prepare to follow this route.

signs.name: Heavy Vehicle Direction
signs.description: Indicates direction heavy vehicles should take.
signs.meaning:
🚚 Indicates a mandatory or advised route for heavy vehicles.
➡️ HGVs should follow the direction shown.
❌ This often helps them avoid unsuitable roads.

signs.name: High Vehicle Advance
signs.description: Advance notice for tall vehicles regarding clearance.
signs.meaning:
🚚 Provides advance warning of a height restriction ahead.
🗺️ Indicates an alternative route for high vehicles.
➡️ Drivers of tall vehicles should prepare to take the diversion.

signs.name: High Vehicle Direction
signs.description: Direction suitable for tall vehicles.
signs.meaning:
🚚 Directs tall vehicles onto a suitable alternative route.
🌉 Helps them avoid a low bridge or other overhead obstruction.
➡️ Follow the arrow if your vehicle is overheight.

signs.name: Hospital Advance Direction
signs.description: Advance sign guiding to hospital facility.
signs.meaning:
🏥 Provides advance notice for the direction to a hospital.
🗺️ Helps you prepare for the turn or exit.
➕ Particularly important for emergency situations.

signs.name: Hospital Direction Sign
signs.description: Direction arrow toward hospital.
signs.meaning:
🏥 Indicates the direction to the nearest hospital at a junction.
➡️ Follow the arrow to get to the medical facility.
➕ Often marked with a red cross.

signs.name: Hospital
signs.description: Hospital located nearby.
signs.meaning:
🏥 Indicates that a hospital is located nearby.
🚗 Be aware of ambulance traffic in the area.
🤫 Drive quietly and respectfully.

signs.name: Junction Definition Post
signs.description: Marker post defining junction reference point.
signs.meaning:
📍 A marker post used to identify a specific motorway junction.
🛣️ It shows the junction number for navigation and reference.
🗺️ Helps drivers confirm their location.

signs.name: Lane Destination Sign (national road)
signs.description: Shows destinations served by each lane.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ Shows which towns or routes each lane leads to.
🚗 Position your vehicle in the correct lane for your destination.
↔️ This helps to reduce last-minute lane changes.

signs.name: Lane Diverge (Three Lanes)
signs.description: Multi-lane diverge upcoming.
signs.meaning:
➗ The road ahead splits, with one lane going one way and two the other.
🚗 Make sure you are in the correct lane for your destination.
🛣️ This often occurs at motorway splits or major junctions.

signs.name: Lane Gain (Three to Four Lanes, 200m)
signs.description: Lane count increases ahead in 200 m.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The road will widen from three to four lanes in 200 metres.
➕ This indicates an increase in road capacity.
🚗 Be aware of traffic movements as the new lane begins.

signs.name: Location Reference Indicator Sign
signs.description: Reference marker for distance or segment ID.
signs.meaning:
📍 Provides a specific location marker on a road.
🔢 The numbers refer to the road and the distance from its starting point.
🆘 Useful for reporting breakdowns or incidents accurately.

signs.name: Map Type Advance Direction Sign (motorway)
signs.description: Diagrammatic motorway junction layout ahead.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ Shows a diagram of the motorway junction ahead.
🚗 Helps you understand the layout and choose the correct lane.
🛣️ Blue signs are for motorways.

signs.name: Map Type Advance Direction Sign (national road)
signs.description: Map-style sign for national road junction.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ Shows a diagram of the junction ahead on a national road.
🚗 Green signs are used for national (non-motorway) routes.
🛣️ Helps you navigate complex junctions.

signs.name: Map Type Advance Direction Sign (regional road, roundabout)
signs.description: Roundabout layout with exits labelled.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ Shows a diagram of the roundabout ahead.
🚗 White signs are typically for regional or local roads.
🛣️ Shows which exit to take for each destination.

signs.name: Metric Speed Limit Information
signs.description: Clarifies speed limits expressed in km/h.
signs.meaning:
ℹ️ Reminds drivers that speed limits are in kilometres per hour (km/h).
🌍 Especially useful for visitors from countries using miles per hour (mph).
🚗 Ensure your speedometer reading corresponds to the limit.

signs.name: Motorway Prohibitions (English)
signs.description: Lists classes banned from motorway.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Lists the types of traffic not allowed on the motorway.
🚶 Prohibited users include pedestrians, cyclists, and learner drivers.
🚜 Slow-moving vehicles are also forbidden.

signs.name: Motorway Prohibitions (Irish)
signs.description: Irish-language list of prohibited motorway users.
signs.meaning:
⛔ Lists motorway prohibitions in the Irish language.
🚶 Prohibited users include pedestrians, cyclists, and learner drivers.
🚜 Slow-moving vehicles are also forbidden.

signs.name: Next Exit Sign (motorway)
signs.description: Indicates next exit name or number.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ Informs you about the next exit on the motorway.
📍 It shows the destination and the distance to the exit.
🚗 This helps you plan your journey and lane changes.

signs.name: Overhead Gantry Sign (motorway, non-lane drop)
signs.description: Over-lane sign giving route or destination info.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ An overhead sign showing destinations for the lanes below.
🛣️ Helps you stay in the correct lane for your onward journey.
🚗 No lanes are ending at this point.

signs.name: Overhead Gantry Sign (national road, lane drop)
signs.description: Overhead sign indicates upcoming lane loss.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ An overhead sign showing destinations for each lane.
❌ The red 'X' indicates that this lane will end (lane drop).
🚗 Move out of the ending lane in good time.

signs.name: Park and Ride Advance Direction
signs.description: Advance sign for Park and Ride facility.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Provides advance notice for a Park and Ride facility.
🚌 You can park your car and take public transport into the city.
🗺️ Helps you prepare for the turn or exit.

signs.name: Park and Ride Direction
signs.description: Direction arrow to Park and Ride.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Indicates the direction to a Park and Ride facility at a junction.
🚌 Follow the arrow to access the parking area.
🚗 A convenient way to avoid city center driving.

signs.name: Parking Advance Direction
signs.description: Advance info for general parking facility.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Provides advance direction to a public car park.
🗺️ Helps drivers locate parking before reaching the center.
🚗 Prepare to turn or exit as indicated.

signs.name: Parking Direction
signs.description: Direction to parking area.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Points in the direction of a public parking area.
➡️ Follow the arrow at a junction to find the car park.
🚗 Helps reduce traffic searching for parking.

signs.name: Parking
signs.description: Designated parking location.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Indicates that parking is permitted in this area.
🚗 Look for other signs that may specify time limits or fees.
✅ You may park your vehicle here.

signs.name: Pedestrian Exit
signs.description: Official exit path for pedestrians.
signs.meaning:
🚶 Indicates the designated exit for pedestrians.
➡️ Follow this sign to leave an area on foot.
✅ Ensures safe separation from vehicle traffic.

signs.name: River Name Sign with Symbol
signs.description: Identifies river crossing.
signs.meaning:
🏞️ Informs you of the name of the river you are crossing.
🌉 A geographical and tourist information sign.
💧 The fish symbol indicates it's a known fishing river.

signs.name: Route Confirmatory Sign (national road)
signs.description: Confirms route number and destination distances.
signs.meaning:
✅ Confirms you are on the correct national road.
🛣️ It shows the road number (e.g., N25).
📍 It also gives the distances to upcoming towns.

signs.name: Shared Space
signs.description: Mixed-priority environment shared by users.
signs.meaning:
🤝 You are entering a shared space zone.
🚶 This area is designed for use by both pedestrians and vehicles.
🐢 Drive very slowly and be prepared to stop at any time.

signs.name: Slow Zone
signs.description: Traffic-calmed area requiring reduced speed.
signs.meaning:
🐢 You are entering a 'Slow Zone'.
🚗 This is a traffic-calmed area where you must drive slowly.
🚶 Be especially aware of pedestrians and cyclists.

signs.name: Speed Camera Ahead
signs.description: Automated enforcement camera ahead.
signs.meaning:
📸 Warns of a speed enforcement camera ahead.
🚗 Ensure you are driving at or below the speed limit.
💰 Failure to comply may result in a fine.

signs.name: Stack Type Advance Direction Sign (regional road)
signs.description: Stacked directional information multiple destinations.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ An advance sign listing destinations in a 'stack'.
⬆️ The top destination is usually the furthest away or straight ahead.
🚗 Helps you prepare for an upcoming junction on a regional road.

signs.name: Start of Motorway Ahead
signs.description: Motorway regulations will begin soon.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The road ahead will soon become a motorway.
⛔ Prepare for motorway restrictions to apply.
🚗 This is your last chance to exit if you are not permitted on the motorway.

signs.name: Start of Motorway
signs.description: Entry point to motorway controlled access.
signs.meaning:
▶️ You are now entering a motorway.
🛣️ Special motorway regulations and speed limits apply from this point.
⛔ Prohibited traffic (e.g., pedestrians, learner drivers) must not enter.

signs.name: Start of Nearside With-Flow Bus Lane
signs.description: Left-side bus lane begins with traffic direction.
signs.meaning:
🚌 Indicates the start of a bus lane on the left side of the road.
⏰ The sign will show the hours of operation.
🚗 Do not drive in the bus lane during its active hours unless permitted.

signs.name: Start of Offside With-Flow Bus Lane
signs.description: Right-side bus lane starts same direction.
signs.meaning:
🚌 Indicates the start of a bus lane on the right side (center) of the road.
⏰ Check the sign for the hours of operation.
🚗 Stay out of the bus lane during its restricted times.

signs.name: Station Advance Direction
signs.description: Advance guidance for station approach.
signs.meaning:
🚉 Provides advance notice for the direction to a train or bus station.
🗺️ Helps you prepare for the upcoming turn or exit.
🚗 Get into the correct lane for the station.

signs.name: Station Direction
signs.description: Direction arrow to station entrance.
signs.meaning:
🚉 Points the way to a nearby train or bus station.
➡️ Follow the arrow at the junction.
📍 Helps you locate public transport hubs.

signs.name: Toll Plaza Ahead
signs.description: Charging point ahead lanes may separate.
signs.meaning:
💰 Warns that you are approaching a toll plaza.
🚗 Prepare to stop and pay the toll.
💳 Have your cash or card ready, and choose the correct lane.

signs.name: Toll Road Ahead
signs.description: Upcoming road section requires toll payment.
signs.meaning:
💰 Informs you that the road ahead is a toll road.
🚗 You will have to pay a fee to use this road.
🗺️ This is your advance warning to decide whether to use the road or seek an alternative.

signs.name: Town and Village Sign (national road)
signs.description: Entering named settlement on national road.
signs.meaning:
🏘️ Indicates that you are entering a town or village.
🐢 Be prepared for a lower speed limit.
🚶 Watch out for pedestrians and local traffic.

signs.name: Town and Village Sign (regional local road)
signs.description: Entering named locality via regional or local route.
signs.meaning:
🏘️ Informs you that you are entering a named town or village.
🐢 A lower speed limit will likely apply.
🚶 Be aware of increased local activity.

signs.name: Town and Village Sign (regional local road, Gaeltacht)
signs.description: Entering Gaelic-speaking locality signage may be Irish only.
signs.meaning:
🏘️ You are entering a town or village in an Irish-speaking (Gaeltacht) area.
🗣️ The name is shown in Irish.
🐢 Be prepared for lower speed limits and local traffic.

signs.name: Town Name and Speed Limit Sign
signs.description: Settlement boundary with posted entering speed limit.
signs.meaning:
🏘️ Indicates you are entering the named town or village.
5️⃣0️⃣ A new, lower speed limit applies from this point.
🐢 Reduce your speed immediately.

signs.name: Tram Information Sign
signs.description: Provides tram-specific operational or routing information.
signs.meaning:
🚋 Provides important information related to trams.
ℹ️ This could include warnings, directions, or rules.
🚗 Pay close attention to the details on the sign.

signs.name: Tunnel Information Sign
signs.description: Displays tunnel name length or special instructions.
signs.meaning:
🚇 You are about to enter a tunnel.
ℹ️ The sign provides the tunnel's name and length.
📜 It may also include important safety instructions.

signs.name: Tunnel Radio Stations
signs.description: Lists frequencies for traffic or emergency updates inside tunnel.
signs.meaning:
📻 Lists the radio frequencies to use inside the tunnel.
🎙️ Tune your radio to one of these stations for traffic and safety announcements.
🚇 This is an important safety feature.

signs.name: Turn Back
signs.description: Ahead route unavailable drivers must reverse direction.
signs.meaning:
⛔ The road ahead is closed with no alternative route.
↩️ You must turn back.
🛑 Do not proceed any further.

signs.name: Turn Headlights On
signs.description: Visibility or environment requires headlights.
signs.meaning:
💡 You must switch on your dipped headlights.
🚇 This is often required when entering a tunnel or a dimly lit area.
🚗 Ensure your lights are on for safety and visibility.

signs.name: Warning Traffic Calming Sign
signs.description: Approaching measures designed to reduce speed.
signs.meaning:
🐢 Warns that you are approaching a traffic-calmed area.
〰️ Expect features like road humps, chicanes, or road narrowing.
🚗 Reduce your speed accordingly.

signs.name: 24-Hour Operation
signs.description: Restriction or rule applies continuously day and night.
signs.meaning:
🕒 The regulation shown on the main sign applies 24 hours a day.
☀️ It is in effect at all times, day and night.
✅ There are no time-based exceptions to the rule.

signs.name: Another Train Coming
signs.description: A second train may arrive after the first has passed.
signs.meaning:
🚆 Used at level crossings with twin tracks.
⚠️ After one train has passed, another may be coming from the other direction.
🛑 Do not cross until you are sure all tracks are clear.

signs.name: Both Ways
signs.description: Hazard or movement affecting traffic in both directions.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Indicates the main sign's message applies in both directions.
➡️⬅️ Often used below a 'No Parking' or 'No Stopping' sign.
🅿️ The restriction applies to the left and right of the sign.

signs.name: Cautionary Speed
signs.description: Advisory safe speed for hazard section.
signs.meaning:
🐢 Recommends a safe speed for the hazard ahead (e.g., a sharp bend).
🚗 This is an advisory speed, not a mandatory limit.
⚠️ You should slow to this speed for safety.

signs.name: Concealed Entrance
signs.description: Hidden access where vehicles may emerge unexpectedly.
signs.meaning:
🙈 Warns of a hidden entrance or junction ahead.
🚗 Vehicles may pull out into the road with little warning.
🐢 Reduce your speed and be prepared to stop.

signs.name: Cycle Network Arrow
signs.description: Direction of designated cycle network route.
signs.meaning:
🚴 Indicates the direction of a numbered cycle route.
🗺️ Helps cyclists navigate the designated network.
➡️ Follow the arrow to stay on the route.

signs.name: Direction - Left
signs.description: Clarifies a left-hand direction for main sign.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ The regulation on the main sign applies to the left of this sign.
🅿️ For example, 'No Parking to the left'.
↔️ The arrow points in the direction the rule is in effect.

signs.name: Direction - Right
signs.description: Indicates a right-hand direction for main sign.
signs.meaning:
➡️ The regulation on the main sign applies to the right of this sign.
🅿️ For example, 'No Parking to the right'.
↔️ The arrow points in the direction the rule is in effect.

signs.name: Direction and Distance - Left
signs.description: Left direction plus distance to hazard or destination.
signs.meaning:
⬅️ The hazard or feature on the main sign is to the left.
📏 It is located at the distance shown on the plate.
🗺️ Provides both direction and distance.

signs.name: Direction and Distance - Right
signs.description: Right direction and remaining distance indicated.
signs.meaning:
➡️ The hazard or feature on the main sign is to the right.
📏 It is located at the distance shown on the plate.
🗺️ Provides both direction and distance information.

signs.name: Distance
signs.description: Distance to start extent or end of related condition.
signs.meaning:
📏 The hazard or regulation on the main sign begins at the distance shown.
⬇️ For example, 'Road Narrows in 100m'.
🚗 Prepare for the condition ahead.

signs.name: End
signs.description: Termination of preceding restriction or condition.
signs.meaning:
✅ Indicates the end of a restriction or regulation.
🔚 For example, placed under a 'No Overtaking' sign to show where the ban finishes.
🚗 Normal rules apply from this point.

signs.name: Exceptions
signs.description: Lists user or vehicle classes exempt from main restriction.
signs.meaning:
ℹ️ Lists exceptions to the rule on the main sign.
🚌 For example, 'No Entry... Except Buses'.
✅ If you are in an excepted category, you may proceed.

signs.name: Hazard - Direction and Distance
signs.description: Indicates where and how far away the hazard lies.
signs.meaning:
🗺️ Specifies the direction and distance to a particular hazard.
⬅️➡️ The arrow points towards the hazard.
📏 The distance tells you how far away it is.

signs.name: Hazard
signs.description: General unspecified hazard.
signs.meaning:
❗️ Used with the 'Other Hazard' sign to describe a specific danger.
ℹ️ The plate will contain text detailing the hazard (e.g., 'Dust Cloud').
🐢 Proceed with caution.

signs.name: Ice
signs.description: Risk of icy surface reducing tyre grip.
signs.meaning:
❄️ Warns of the risk of ice on the road ahead.
🐢 Slow down significantly and avoid harsh braking or steering.
🚗 Often placed with a 'Slippery Road' sign in winter.

signs.name: kmh
signs.description: Speeds referenced in kilometres per hour.
signs.meaning:
ℹ️ Clarifies that the speed shown is in kilometres per hour.
🐢 Used with advisory speed signs.
🚗 A reminder of the unit of measurement.

signs.name: Length
signs.description: States longitudinal extent of a zone.
signs.meaning:
📏 Indicates the length over which a hazard or regulation applies.
↔️ For example, 'Road Narrows for 2km'.
🚗 Be aware that the condition persists for the distance shown.

signs.name: Long Low Vehicles
signs.description: Presence or vulnerability of long low vehicles.
signs.meaning:
🚚 Warns that long, low vehicles may have difficulty or be present.
↔️ Often used with signs for hump back bridges or level crossings.
🐢 Be patient and give them space.

signs.name: LRT Information
signs.description: Supplementary data related to light rail transit operations.
signs.meaning:
🚋 Provides additional information about trams (Light Rail Transit).
ℹ️ Used below other signs to clarify a situation involving trams.
🚗 Pay attention to the specific warning or instruction.

signs.name: Oil Spill
signs.description: Possible oil contamination reducing surface friction.
signs.meaning:
💧 Warns of a potential oil spill on the road surface.
🚗 This can make the road extremely slippery.
🐢 Reduce speed and avoid sudden manoeuvres.

signs.name: On Slip Road
signs.description: Indicates restriction applies specifically to slip road.
signs.meaning:
🛣️ The main sign's warning or rule applies to the slip road only.
↘️ For example, 'Queues Likely on Slip Road'.
🚗 Be prepared for the condition as you enter or exit.

signs.name: Oncoming Traffic
signs.description: Warning that opposing traffic may appear close.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Warns that you may face oncoming traffic.
🚗 Often used when a one-way street ends or you join a two-way road.
👀 Be prepared to keep to your side of the road.

signs.name: Parking
signs.description: Indicates permitted parking area within rule context.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Specifies that the area is designated for parking.
ℹ️ Often used with other signs to provide more detail.
🚗 Clarifies the purpose of the bay or area.

signs.name: Pedestrian Zone
signs.description: Area reserved for pedestrians vehicles excluded.
signs.meaning:
🚶 Indicates you are entering a pedestrian-only zone.
⛔ Vehicles are generally prohibited.
⏰ Check for signs indicating times when access may be permitted.

signs.name: Periods of Operation
signs.description: Shows specific times a linked restriction is active.
signs.meaning:
⏰ The restriction on the main sign only applies during the times shown.
🗓️ It may also specify days of the week.
✅ Outside these times, the restriction does not apply.

signs.name: Reduce Speed Now
signs.description: Immediate speed reduction required.
signs.meaning:
❗️ You must reduce your speed immediately.
🐢 There is a hazard directly ahead.
🚗 Do not wait to slow down.

signs.name: Safe Headroom
signs.description: Indicates available overhead clearance safe up to displayed height.
signs.meaning:
↕️ Indicates the safe overhead clearance under a bridge or structure.
🚚 Drivers of tall vehicles must ensure they have enough height.
✅ It is safe to proceed if your vehicle is lower than the height shown.

signs.name: Safe Overtaking of Cyclists 1.0m
signs.description: Advises minimum 1.0 m lateral clearance when passing cyclists.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Advises drivers to leave at least 1 metre of space when overtaking cyclists.
🚴 This applies on roads with a speed limit of 50 km/h or less.
🚗 Give cyclists room for safety.

signs.name: Safe Overtaking of Cyclists 1.5m
signs.description: Advises minimum 1.5 m clearance when passing cyclists.
signs.meaning:
↔️ Advises drivers to leave at least 1.5 metres of space when overtaking cyclists.
🚴 This applies on roads with a speed limit over 50 km/h.
🚗 Give cyclists plenty of room.

signs.name: Shoulder Closed
signs.description: Hard shoulder not available for stopping or refuge.
signs.meaning:
⛔ The hard shoulder is closed.
🚗 Do not use it for stopping, even in an emergency.
🚧 This may be due to roadworks or an obstruction.

signs.name: Slow
signs.description: Immediate need to reduce speed.
signs.meaning:
🐢 Advises you to slow down.
⚠️ There is a potential hazard ahead.
🚗 Proceed at a reduced speed with caution.

signs.name: Time Limit
signs.description: Maximum duration allowed for activity.
signs.meaning:
⏰ Specifies the maximum time you are allowed to park.
🅿️ For example, 'Parking... 1 Hour'.
✅ Make sure to move your vehicle before the time limit expires.

signs.name: Traffic Calming Ahead
signs.description: Approaching measures designed to slow traffic.
signs.meaning:
🐢 Warns of traffic calming measures ahead.
〰️ Expect features like road humps or chicanes.
🚗 Reduce your speed and drive carefully.

signs.name: Tram Track
signs.description: Presence of tram rails reducing tyre grip.
signs.meaning:
🚋 Warns that tram tracks are present.
 slippery, especially for cyclists and motorcyclists.
🚗 Be careful when crossing the tracks.

signs.name: Turn Off Engine When Stopped
signs.description: Requirement to shut engine while stationary.
signs.meaning:
🚫 You must turn off your engine if you are stopped for more than a moment.
🌿 This is usually for environmental reasons, e.g., in tunnels or near schools.
🚗 Helps reduce air pollution.

signs.name: Type of Works (used for sign WK 001)
signs.description: Detail describing nature of the roadworks.
signs.meaning:
ℹ️ Provides specific details about the type of roadworks taking place.
👷 For example, 'Grass Cutting' or 'Surveying'.
🚧 Used below the general 'Roadworks Ahead' sign.

signs.name: Unfinished Road Surface
signs.description: Surface incomplete lowering grip and comfort.
signs.meaning:
🚧 The road surface ahead is not finished.
🚗 Expect a bumpy ride and potentially reduced grip.
🐢 Slow down and drive with extra care.

signs.name: Use Shoulder
signs.description: Instruction to route traffic temporarily onto shoulder.
signs.meaning:
🚗 You are instructed to drive on the hard shoulder.
↔️ This is a temporary measure to keep traffic moving past an incident or roadworks.
🚧 Follow the instructions and merge back when indicated.

signs.name: Zonal No Parking
signs.description: Entire marked zone prohibits parking until zone end sign.
signs.meaning:
🅿️ Placed with a 'No Parking' sign to indicate the start of a controlled zone.
🚫 Parking is prohibited on all roads within this zone.
🔚 The restriction applies until you see an 'End of Zone' sign.
